Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.

THE ROLE We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.

What You'll Do


Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making



Requirements

WHAT YOU'LL BRING


At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English



What We Offer


Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Premium relocation support for colleagues outside of Germany: visa application support, assistance with searching temporary accommodation, payment of the first monthly rent
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role


Perform strategic data analyses with direct impact to decision making of leadership team
Help building data pipelines and data models
Build and maintain automated dashboards and reports that are effective in helping stakeholders monitor key performance indicators and easily make decisions
Serve as a point of contact for ad-hoc data questions and requests


Required

About you


Background in a STEM degree, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience
Experience with one or more scripting languages, e.g. Python or JavaScript
Good knowledge of SQL and initial experience with visualization/BI tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Metabase)
First experience in data analytics either through internships or a full-time position
Excellent problem solving skills and always work in a solution-oriented and detailed manner
Curious and self-driven approach, as well as the ability to extract clear objectives and requirements from broad challenges or questions
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interact with stakeholders
Fluent in German


Nice to have / big plus


Data warehousing experience with dbt
Experience with cloud services, e.g. GCP (Google Cloud Platform)
Understanding of ETL (/ELT) processes
Experience working with ambiguity in a scale-up (or scale-up-like) environment


About Us

At LANCH, we empower small gastronomy owners by giving them the tools needed to make food delivery fun again. We are building the world’s biggest virtual food court by creating high-quality delivery brands together with the megastars of our generation. LANCH is food delivery built for 2024. Backed by HV Capital, Felix Capital and a bunch of superstar angels such as the founders of FlixBus, Gorillas, Flaschenpost, Glovo, Foodspring, Foodora, Honest Food, Finleap and the most known YouTubers, rap stars and athletes of our time.

LIFE AT LANCH


A steep learning curve with a high career growth trajectory and massive ownership
Hybrid working and flexible working hours combined with a fair target salary
Offsite team events and regular get-togethers
Unique team spirit and flat hierarchies
Amazing 40 people team & highly experienced leadership team to learn from
Value-centered decision making: fast, transparent, creative and fun
Team offsites every 16 weeks to come together in-person & strengthen our relationships
Complete ownership on every level

Title: Data Analyst (d/m/w)
Description:
Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.




IHRE AUFGABENSCHWERPUNKTE

Extrahierung und Sammlung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, darunter Logdateien, Datenbanken und Monitoring-Tools
Bereinigung, Transformation und Standardisierung von Daten, um ihre Qualität und Konsistenz sicherzustellen
Automatisierung von Datenerfassungs- und Bereinigungsprozessen
Durchführung von Leistungsanalysen und Erstellung von Prognosemodellen
Entwicklung von Dashboards und Berichten zur Visualisierung von Leistungsindikatoren, Sicherheitsmetriken und anderen relevanten Kennzahlen







WAS SIE DAFÜR MITBRINGEN

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Statistik oder einem verwandten Bereich
Mindestens zwei Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Datenanalyse, vorzugsweise im IT-Bereich
Fundierte Kenntnisse in Datenbankabfragesprachen wie SQL sowie Programmierkenntnisse in Python, R oder ähnlichen Sprachen
Erfahrung mit Tools und Technologien zur Datenvisualisierung, wie z.B. Tableau, Grafana oder Kibana
Starke analytische Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit, komplexe technische Probleme zu lösen
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse







WARUM SIE BEI UNS GENAU RICHTIG SIND

Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm







Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.




Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung.




Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




Your Responsibilities:

Management of and participation in Ecom&ERP projects in the BI environment
Implementation of change requests from the Ecom/CRM Team in the BI environment
Close cooperation with external service providers and partners
Ensuring operation & support for the BI systems of the Carhartt WIP Ecom&APP
Technical contact for the BI architecture in the ERP/Ecom environment




Your Profile:

Very good technical understanding of ERP, Commercetools and DWH architecture
At least 5 years of professional experience in a comparable function
Experience in working with Power BI is a plus
Entrepreneurial mindset and high customer orientation
Hands on and agile Mindset
Very good process understanding in the ecom&retail landscape
Very good technological understanding in the reporting area
Good analytical and logical thinking skills
Very good communication skills




Your Benefits:

Be part of the progress - find your place in our unique WIP culture
As part of the WIP crew you have the opportunity to connect at our events or just have fun
Your closet benefits from our staff discounts
Your future, our upgrade - we subsidise your company pension scheme by 100%
Your well-being is important to us - we contribute to this with free beverages




Your Location:

Berlin (Kreuzberg) / Germany

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
GOhiring is the leading software company for automated job posting and recruiting analytics. With our tool, recruiters can manage the entire job posting process in one place – from data-driven multiposting campaigns to in-depth analysis along the candidate journey. We help recruiters make the most out of their online job postings.

Your role


Developing analyses, visualisations, and reporting for internal and external clients
Creating and tuning dashboards, using Power BI, that visualise and analyse data from HR processes
Automating reports and data transformations with Airflow
Gathering and defining data pipeline requirements
Managing the scalability and rollout of our analytics dashboards
Grow with your role


Your profile


BSc or MSc in a data-oriented field of studies or statistics
2+ years of professional experience in a similar role
Profound experience with SQL, PowerBI, and Data Modeling
Proven track record of hands-on development of PowerBI dashboards
Experience with an orchestration tool, preferably Airflow
Experience with Data Visualization
Ideally, experience with embedded PowerBI solutions or capacity planning
You are curious about the data world and are not afraid to ask questions and like to research to find solutions to arising challenges
The quality of your work is important to you
Interest in growing and learning with a team long-term
Fluent in English


We offer


Remote Work: Work from where you are most productive - be it at home, while traveling or in our office in Berlin.
Flexibility: Look forward to processes and mindsets that are 100% geared towards time-flexible and location-independent work.
Making a big difference in a small team: We believe that small teams are more fun. Direct collaboration, lots of creative freedom, learning from each other - that's our understanding of productivity.
More than a job - discovering the future: You'll work at the heart of digitalization in recruiting and perhaps discover the job of a lifetime.
Choose your device - we pay: For your remote job you'll get a laptop and a technical setup of your choice.
World-class team and onboarding: Your team members Lucas and Rémy will guide you through our hands-on onboarding, so you feel in good hands from the very beginning. Here you can meet the team.
Two Offsites a year: Twice a year you will spend a week with all your coworkers in different locations within Europe.
Keep growing: Take advantage of our training opportunities using various training platforms.


Want to work together on the future of recruiting?

Simply send us your CV or LinkedIn / Xing profile. No cover letter needed. We are happy to hear from you.

Diversity and equal opportunity are very important to us. We are happy about the interest of all candidates and strive to provide feedback as quickly as possible.
Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

We simplify wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, we’re here to help people trust themselves enough to build their financial freedom — for now and the future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks*, precious metals and commodities* they want — with any sized budget, 24/7. Our global team works across different cultures and time zones, bringing our products to more than 4 million customers, making us one of Europe’s safest and most secure platforms that powers modern investing.

Headquartered in Austria but operating across Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, “roll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen” kind of people. It’s these diverse perspectives and innovative minds operating as ONE TEAM that keep Bitpanda at the cutting edge of our industry. So if you’re someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let’s go!

Your mission

As a Marketing Strategy and Data Analyst at Bitpanda, you will be supporting the Commercial Strategy and Operations team with the completion of day-to-day tasks. These include data analysis and preparation of different campaigns, reporting on performance metrics, and management of ongoing projects.

What You’ll Do


Bring together, explore and analyse large-scale datasets to find actionable marketing insights
Provide a better understanding of customers, their user characteristics and how they use our products
Collaborate across multiple teams and departments to help support a data-driven marketing team
Create interactive reports and dashboards to solve specific needs and empower key stakeholders
Extract key insights and lessons from post-campaign performance data to shape upcoming product launches and marketing campaigns



Who You Are


Relevant years of experience in a data analytics role
A data enthusiast who can translate complex topics into simple and actionable insights
Relevant experience in marketing analytics, consumer insights and/or business analysis.
Excellent data visualisation skills with expertise in tools such as Tableau and Excel. Strong SQL skills and familiarity with Snowflake.
Detail orientation, proactivity, strong analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills.



What’s In It For You


Hybrid-working model with a 50/50 split between in-office and home, plus 60 Work From Anywhere days annually
Total compensation package including participation in our Bitpanda stock option plan
Competitive benefits programs and policies shaped by our flexibility-first philosophy
Exclusive premiums when trading on Bitpanda
Company-wide and team events — both in-person and virtually!
Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brand



And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda’s incredible journey towards being Europe’s future #1 investment platform.

Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.
Show more

Title: Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
Werde Teil unserer Mission, werde Teil von Doctolib!

Doctolib sucht einen erfahrenen Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m), der unsere Sales Teams unterstützt und wertvolle Einblicke aus unseren Verkaufsdaten gewinnt. Als Teil des Sales Excellence Teams optimierst du Effizienz und Leistung unserer Vertriebsteams und trägst damit direkt zum Erfolg des Deutschland-Geschäfts bei.

Deine Aufgaben


Du identifizierst Verbesserungspotentiale auf Basis unserer Datengrundlage und leitest daraus Maßnahmen ab, um die Performance unserer Sales Team zu verbessern
Du baust Analysen für das Management und unterstützt Entscheidungsprozesse mit Hilfe von fundierten Datengrundlagen
Du vereinfachst den Zugang zu relevanten Sales-Daten mit Hilfe von Dashboards und Self-Service Tools
Du trainierst die User (Sales Manager:innen), damit sie die aufbereiteten Daten zur Effizienzsteigerung verschiedener Sales-Prozesse nutzen können
Du bist die zentrale Kontaktperson für unser globales Data Team, um die Data Roadmap und die Anfragen für Dashboards und Ad-hoc Data Requests zu besprechen
Du lernst mit unseren BI / Reporting Tools Periscope Data und Tableau umzugehen - hierzu bieten wir dir eine ausführliche Einarbeitung



Dein Profil

Vorab der kurze Hinweis: Falls Du dem unten beschriebenen Profil nicht exakt entsprichst, aber trotzdem der Meinung bist, dass die Stellenausschreibung zu Deinen Fähigkeiten passt: Bewirb Dich gerne trotzdem!

Um Teil unseres Teams zu werden, bringst du Folgendes mit:


Du bringst min. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Sales Performance / Strategy / Data Analytics oder einem ähnlichen Bereich mit
Du hast eine strukturierte, analytische Arbeitsweise und arbeitest dich gerne tiefgehend in neue Themenbereichen ein
Dir macht es Spaß, komplexe Daten in aussagekräftige Erkenntnisse umzuwandeln sowie neue Lösungen zu entwickeln und das Team für die Umsetzung zu begeistern
Du liebst es mit Excel/G-Sheet zu arbeiten; erste Kenntnisse in SQL, Tableau oder Metabase sind ein Plus
Zudem verfügst du über ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, die du in verhandlungssicherem Deutsch und sehr gutem Englisch zum Ausdruck bringen kannst



Was wir Dir bieten


ein Aktienoptionsprogramm für alle Doctoliber
eine betriebliche Krankenversicherung mit tollen Zusatzleistungen
Vierteljährlicher und ein kompetitives Gehaltspaket
28 Urlaubstage + 1 Tag zusätzlich für jedes volle Beschäftigungs-Kalenderjahr (max. 30 Tage)
Das Doctolib Parent Care Programm, das extra Elternzeit (1 Monat) uvm. enthält
Solidarity Days: 2 Tage pro Jahr, um Wohltätigkeitsorganisationen im Gesundheitswesen zu unterstützen
Mentales Wohlbefinden durch Zugang zu Coaches und Psychologen in Zusammenarbeit mit externen Partnern
Ein flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell, das hybrides- und Büro-basiertes Arbeiten ermöglicht
Flexibility Days: 10 Tage im Jahr aus dem EU-Ausland oder UK arbeiten
Erstattung der ÖPNV-Kosten
Verpflegung Budget und gesunde Snacks im Büro
Ein gefördertes Sportangebot mit unserem Partner Urban Sports Club



Der Interview-Prozess


Erstes Interview mit deinem Talent Partner (30 Min)
Interview mit dem Team Manager (1h)
Finales Interview + Case Study (1h)
Mindestens eine Referenzprüfung



Job Details


Festanstellung / Unbefristeter Vertrag
Vollzeit
Arbeitsort: Berlin
Startdatum: ab sofort
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell



Doctolib ist ein Arbeitgeber, der Chancengleichheit fördert und Vielfalt schätzt. Wir freuen uns über alle Bewerbungen und bearbeiten diese völlig unabhängig von Geschlecht, Religionszugehörigkeit, Hautfarbe, Herkunft, sexueller Orientierung, Alter, Familienstand oder Behindertenstatus.

Alle mit diesem Formular übermittelten Informationen werden von Doctolib zum Zweck der Verwaltung der Bewerbungen verarbeitet. Für weitere Informationen über die Verarbeitung Ihrer Bewerbungsdaten durch Doctolib, klicke bitte hier.

Wenn Du Deine Rechte ausüben möchtest oder Fragen zur Verarbeitung Deiner Daten hast, kannst Du Dich schriftlich an uns wenden unter hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.







THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Analyst at Oetker Digital, you will play a critical role in owning and leveraging data to drive business decisions and strategies. You will work closely with various teams and business partners on the side of our Group companies to ask the right questions, deeply understand the business domains and processes, analyze datasets, generate insights and business cases based on data that help our brands grow and succeed in the digital space. Your expertise will guide the optimization of brand, marketing and sales strategies, product development, and customer engagement initiatives.







WHAT YOU'LL DO

Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs and objectives
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key business partners to ensure data solutions align with business goals
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Analyze datasets to extract actionable insights and support data-driven decision making
Develop and implement statistical models to solve complex business problems
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights through effective data storytelling







WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 5 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Experience in Marketing Analytics & Optimization
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
You like to learn, work hands-on, take ownership, and have an impact
Fluent in German and English







WHAT WE OFFER

Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners







Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Remote within Austria, Germany, and Spain. Hybrid is also possible in Vienna, Berlin, and Madrid.

Your Role in Our Journey


Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.


Your impact


3+ years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects. Experience in attribution modeling is a plus.
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
Expert-level knowledge of Tableau with outstanding data storytelling skills.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes. Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms is a plus.
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.


Your way to unlock your full potential


Disrupting Education: Join us for a unique opportunity to disrupt the traditional education landscape. It's not just a job; it's a chance to be part of something big and meaningful.
Global Dream Team: Say hello to an international and diverse crew of thinkers, doers, and magic makers. Get ready to be inspired daily by your colleagues from around the world.
Work, Your Way: We offer a flexible, hybrid work environment that respects your need for work-life harmony with 2/3 remote days a week & 5 fully remote weeks a year so you can shine in a way that suits you best.
Office Shenanigans: Our regular team and office events will keep your spirits high. We believe in bonding, celebrating, and having a blast together.
Strength in Unity: Join one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and be part of communities that champion causes you're passionate about.
Growing is LIT: The sky's the limit in our EdTech playground. Access a wide array of online and in-person learning and development opportunities to build your career as high as your dreams can take you.
Support Around the Clock: We've got your back 24/7. Enjoy a comprehensive Employee Support Programme that's not just for you but for your loved ones too.


Life at GoStudent:

Do you want to reimagine education together with us and join a mission to believe in?

GoStudent is one of the world’s leading tutoring providers and education platforms. We’re also a unicorn and have raised more than €675m investment to date. Together with our acquisitions Seneca Learning, Tus Media and Studienkreis, we currently support more than 11 million families each month to fulfil our vision to help each student reach their full potential.

We are passionate about disrupting the future of education and making a real impact. Join our journey and unlock your creativity and advance your career by mastering exciting challenges together with an international, driven team. We are here to support your goals and to discover how far we can reach by growing smarter and stronger together. If this sounds good to you, then join us now and unlock your full potential.

Openness Statement

At GoStudent, we are an open and welcoming bunch that values your unique skills, passion, and potential. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality, or political views, but rather focus on your talent and motivation to contribute to the future of learning. Even if you are a unicorn - just as GoStudent is: if you believe that you can make a positive impact, we encourage you to throw your hat in the ring & to apply, regardless of whether you meet every requirement. Our team is diverse, and we believe that this diversity fosters creativity and innovation, making us a better company. Join us in reimagining the future of learning!

Learn more about "Who we are"

Please upload your CV/Resume in PDF format, preferably in English, as a DOC format might not be supported.

Disclose Privacy & Compliance Information

Title: Data Analyst, Finance & Strategy
Description:
About Gelato

Gelato has built the world's largest and most global network for on-demand production of customized items e.g. t-shirts, wall art, mugs, books, hoodies, and cards. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs to sell their creativity globally, with a more local and sustainable production. With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.

We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We have more than 130 production partners in 32 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people with customized products in a smarter, faster, and greener way.

Gelato is changing the way that customized products can be produced on-demand. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses. With local production, and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste and carbon emissions are reduced.

Gelato consists of three different business units:

Optimalprint - our B2C e-commerce business, offering beautiful high-quality personalized products to consumers all over the world. The products are produced on-demand by Gelato’s local production network.

GelatoCreate - giving creators across the world instant access to a global market of customers. Simple integrations to webshops such as Shopify, Etsy and TikTok allow creators to connect and personalize their designs for a wide range of quality products, and Gelato takes care of the production and fulfillment through our local production.

GelatoConnect - the backbone of Gelato is enterprise software that powers the world's most advanced production on demand facilities, providing unmatched production workflow, logistics and procurement efficiency, quality management and cost savings.




What we are looking for

We are seeking analytics professionals with a passion for business impact to join our world class Finance & Strategy team. As a Data Analyst, you will help build strategic reports for investor and leadership teams and carry out analysis that will inform important financial and strategic decisions for Gelato. You will guide the finance team using data and insights by not simply presenting data, but telling data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your finance and strategy team members using clear insights and recommendations.

The position is based in Gelato’s offices in London (UK), Oslo (Norway), Stockholm (Sweden), and Madrid (Spain)

What you will be doing

Own the design, development, and maintenance of metrics, reports and dashboards to drive key business performance visibility for finance and strategy teams.
Identify trends & patterns using internal and external data sources powered with analytic models to provide actionable insights to business decision-makers.
Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans necessary to drive and influence business decision-making.
Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices.

Who you are

4 years+ of data analytics experience.
Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and integrity in all your analyses
Good time management. You can handle multiple tasks, meeting deadlines without compromising quality.
Collaborative. You work well in a team environment, collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong project and stakeholder management skills. You keep all stakeholders informed and manage expectations effectively.
Extensive hands-on experience in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and BI tools like Looker/Tableau/PowerBI.
Good knowledge of statistical analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with finance data or in finance related roles.
Advanced experience with Looker.
Experience in management consulting would be a plus.

What we offer

We offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.

Some of the highlights of the package include:

Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvement
Chance to become a shareholder of Gelato!
Flexible festive holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Work at one of our hub city offices or even remotely
And much much more!

What it’s like to work at Gelato

We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.

At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.

Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in English, regardless of which country you are applying from.

Show more

With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.

We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We have more than 130 production partners in 32 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people with customized products in a smarter, faster, and greener way.

Gelato is changing the way that customized products can be produced on-demand. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses. With local production, and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste and carbon emissions are reduced.

Gelato consists of three different business units:

Optimalprint - our B2C e-commerce business, offering beautiful high-quality personalized products to consumers all over the world. The products are produced on-demand by Gelato’s local production network.

GelatoCreate - giving creators across the world instant access to a global market of customers. Simple integrations to webshops such as Shopify, Etsy and TikTok allow creators to connect and personalize their designs for a wide range of quality products, and Gelato takes care of the production and fulfillment through our local production.

GelatoConnect - the backbone of Gelato is enterprise software that powers the world's most advanced production on demand facilities, providing unmatched production workflow, logistics and procurement efficiency, quality management and cost savings.


What we are looking for

We are seeking analytics professionals with a passion for business impact to join our world class Finance & Strategy team. As a Data Analyst, you will help build strategic reports for investor and leadership teams and carry out analysis that will inform important financial and strategic decisions for Gelato. You will guide the finance team using data and insights by not simply presenting data, but telling data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your finance and strategy team members using clear insights and recommendations.

The position is based in Gelato’s offices in London (UK), Oslo (Norway), Stockholm (Sweden), and Madrid (Spain)

What you will be doing

  • Own the design, development, and maintenance of metrics, reports and dashboards to drive key business performance visibility for finance and strategy teams.
  • Identify trends & patterns using internal and external data sources powered with analytic models to provide actionable insights to business decision-makers.
  • Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans necessary to drive and influence business decision-making.
  • Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices.

Who you are

  • 4 years+ of data analytics experience.
  • Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and integrity in all your analyses
  • Good time management. You can handle multiple tasks, meeting deadlines without compromising quality.
  • Collaborative. You work well in a team environment, collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Strong project and stakeholder management skills. You keep all stakeholders informed and manage expectations effectively.
  • Extensive hands-on experience in SQL.
  • Experience with data visualization and BI tools like Looker/Tableau/PowerBI.
  • Good knowledge of statistical analysis.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with finance data or in finance related roles.
  • Advanced experience with Looker.
  • Experience in management consulting would be a plus.

What we offer

We offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.

Some of the highlights of the package include:

  • Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvement
  • Chance to become a shareholder of Gelato!
  • Flexible festive holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
  • Work at one of our hub city offices or even remotely
  • And much much more!

What it’s like to work at Gelato

We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.

At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.

Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in English, regardless of which country you are applying from.

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Unser Ziel ist eine Solaranlage auf jedem Dach, ein Speicher in jedem Haus, und ein E-Auto in jeder Garage. Um unseren Kunden das beste Komplettpaket am Markt anzubieten, starten wir seit dem letzten Jahr auch im Bereich Wärmepumpe durch. Im Jahr 2023 haben wir bereits über 1000 Wärmepumpen installiert und sind auf dem besten Weg, diese Zahl 2024 um das fünf- bis zehnfache zu steigern.

Wie wir das schaffen? Enpal macht Wärmepumpe endlich einfach: Wir bieten unseren Kunden Wärmepumpen über Kauf und Finanzierung zum All-inclusive-Tarif an und ermöglichen eine intelligente Anbindung in das Enpal Energie Ökosystem.

Auf unserem Weg zum größten Energieunternehmen Europas stehen wir gerade erst am Anfang. Deshalb sind wir auf der Suche nach Talenten, die uns auf diesem Weg begleiten, ihren Fußabdruck hinterlassen und Erfolge gemeinsam mit uns feiern. Bei uns findest Du ein dynamisches Arbeitsumfeld, genauso wie den Raum, Dich persönlich und fachlich weiterzuentwickeln und Deine Stärken wirkungsvoll einzusetzen. 

Als erstes grünes Unicorn in Deutschland und wachstumsstärkstes Energieunternehmen in Europa (FT1000 Ranking 2022 von Financial Times & Statista) treiben wir unsere Mission von grüner Energie für alle weiter voran. Sei auch Du Teil dieser Erfolgsgeschichte und verändere mit uns gemeinsam die Welt! 

Aufbauend auf unseren Erfolg im PV-Geschäft, ziehen wir nun den größten D2C Wärmepumpenvertrieb in Europa hoch. Werde Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte!

Stellenbeschreibung


Erfahrener Teil des Teams werden: Werde ein wertvoller Teil unseres Tech - Venture Development Teams und sammle praktische Erfahrungen.
Mitwirkung an bedeutenden Projekten: Arbeite Seite an Seite mit dem Senior Leadership und dem Tech Lead an spannenden Projekten und gewinne Einblicke in die technologische Entwicklung des Unternehmens.
Projektmanagement: Treibe eigenständig Projekte voran, insbesondere in den Bereichen Data Analytics, Automatisierungen, Tech Integration und CRM-Management.
Analytische Fähigkeiten: Nutze Deine mehrjährige Erfahrung, um schnell Ansatzpunkte und Optimierungspotenziale zu identifizieren und gemeinsam mit Stakeholdern innovative Lösungsansätze zu entwickeln.
End-to-End Umsetzung: Begleite Deine Projekte von der Konzeption bis zur erfolgreichen Implementierung.
Verantwortung übernehmen: Übernehme die Verantwortung für die Gestaltung, Planung und Umsetzung von abteilungsübergreifenden Programmen und Maßnahmen im Bereich der technologischen Entwicklung. Werde Ansprechpartner für unsere Stakeholder und deine Teamkollegen für alle Themen rund um BI.
Enge Zusammenarbeit: Arbeite eng mit verschiedenen Abteilungen und dem Senior Leadership zusammen, um aktiv zur Wachstumsgeschichte von Enpal beizutragen.
Raum für Entfaltung: Entdecke bei Enpal eine spannende Herausforderung, die Deine Expertise anerkennt und Dir gleichzeitig Raum für neue Impulse und Entwicklungen bietet.



Qualifikationen


Du hast erfolgreich in einem Bereich studiert, der idealerweise an der Schnittstelle zwischen BWL und Informatik oder einem ähnlichen Fach liegt.
Du hast während deines Studiums 2-3 Praktika machen können und suchst nun nach einem Festeinstieg oder hast 1-2 Jahre Berufserfahrung. 
Du hast erste Erfahrung in einem der Bereichen Startups, Consulting oder ähnlichen schnelllebigen und anspruchsvollen Bereichen sammeln können.
Du beherrschst SQL und Excel im Schlaf. Du bringst auch erste Kenntnisse in Python oder einer anderen Programmiersprache mit.
Du hast erste Erfahrungen in Dashboarding Lösungen (insbesondere Tableau).
Du hast Lust dich durch einen großen Haufen an Daten zu wühlen, um KPIs zu bauen und wichtige Kennzahlen zu definieren.
Deine ausgeprägten Kommunikationsfähigkeiten ermöglichen eine effektive Zusammenarbeit mit internen und externen Stakeholdern.
Du legst nicht nur hohe Qualitätsansprüche an Deine Arbeit, sondern bringst auch eine Can-Do-Mentalität mit, die Dich selbst und andere motiviert.
Du hast mindestens B2-Kenntnisse in Deutsch und sprichst flüssiges Englisch.



Auch wenn Du nicht alle oben genannten Anforderungen erfüllst, ermutigen wir Dich dennoch, Dich zu bewerben. Wir sind der Meinung, dass vielfältige Perspektiven und Erfahrungen unser Team bereichern und fördern eine Kultur des kontinuierlichen Lernens und Wachstums. Deine einzigartige Erfahrung und Fähigkeiten könnten genau das sein, was wir brauchen!

Zusätzliche Informationen


Arbeite in Deutschlands erstem grünen Unicorn und gestalte aktiv die solare Energiewende mit.
Die Sonne scheint auf der ganzen Welt - Bei Enpal findest du ein hochmotiviertes und diverses Team, mit mehr als 65 verschiedenen Nationalitäten.
Lieber dem Haustier daheim oder den Kolleg:innen im Büro Gesellschaft leisten? Auch nach der Pandemie bieten wir dir ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell.
Wir erfüllen jedes Startup-Klischee - In unserem modernen Office in Berlin findest du von Tischtennisplatte und Yoga-Ecke bis Dachterrasse und gefüllten Getränkekühlschränken alles was das Herz begehrt.
Dein Kick-start bei Enpal - Lerne an deinem Onboarding-Tag das Unternehmen, deine Teamkolleg:innen und unseren Gründer Mario kennen.
Bleib auf dem Laufenden - Egal ob Unternehmenszahlen bei unseren monatlichen All-Hands-Meetings oder die Funktionsweise einer Photovoltaikanlage beim Lunch & Learn, du weißt immer genau Bescheid.
Energiewende geht nur gemeinsam - Bei Enpal erwartet dich ein legendärer Teamspirit und unvergessliche Teamevents.
Ohne Fehler kein Fortschritt - Wir leben eine starke Feedback-Kultur und wachsen mit deinem Input, entweder auf persönlichem Weg oder anonym über unser Feedback-Tool Culture Amp.



Wir bei Enpal sind stolz auf die Vielfältigkeit unseres Teams. Weder bei der Einstellung noch während des Beschäftigungsverhältnisses werden Entscheidungen auf Basis von Hautfarbe, Religion oder religiösen Glaubens, ethnischer oder nationaler Herkunft, Nationalität, Geschlechteridentität, sexuelle Orientierung, Behinderung oder Alter getroffen. Enpal steht für einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz und geht gegen Diskriminierung und Belästigung jeglicher Art vor.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Do you have strong background in Data Analysis?




Do you want to apply your skills and grow within a growing market?




We've partnered with a leading supplier of modern and professional learning solutions.




You will analyze large amounts of data to identify trends in their SaaS platform and generate insights. Through these analyses, you will generate insights for their product team and various stakeholders and actively contribute to their data driven product development.




Please apply if you have the following:

A bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
You can record, analyze, develop solutions and master various tools for data analysis and visualization such as Mixpanel or Looker Studio.
Strong analytical skills with storytelling and visualization techniques to prepare findings in a way that is appropriate for the target group.
Ideally, you have knowledge of SQL, Python or R.
You have experience with cloud-based data platforms.
You have experience in sales processes and automation and data structures (ideally in Salesforce).
You have experience in an agile environment
6+ years industry experience




Nice to have:

Good communication skills in German and English




This is an urgent position. If the above stands out to you and you feel you are right for the role, please do send in your application/ get in touch with a member of the Big Cloud team as soon as possible. Please be aware, we try to reply to all applications, but we’re only human, for now! Please bare in-mind, you may only hear from us if you are successful.

Show more

You will analyze large amounts of data to identify trends in their SaaS platform and generate insights. Through these analyses, you will generate insights for their product team and various stakeholders and actively contribute to their data driven product development.

Please be aware, we try to reply to all applications, but we’re only human, for now! Please bare in-mind, you may only hear from us if you are successful.

Title: Remote Data Integrity Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a meticulous Remote Data Integrity Analyst to ensure the accuracy and reliability of our data entries into company databases and CRM systems. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, a keen eye for detail, and a commitment to data integrity.

Responsibilities:


Verify and correct data entries for accuracy and completeness.
Conduct regular data audits to ensure data integrity.
Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information responsibly.
Perform regular data backups and digital filing.
Assist with other administrative tasks as required.


Qualifications:


High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or certification in data management is a plus.
Proven experience as a data entry clerk or similar position.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel) and Google Workspace.
Familiarity with data entry software and tools.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace.


Benefits:


Competitive hourly wage.
Flexible working hours.
Opportunity to work from the comfort of your home.
Supportive and collaborative team environment.
Opportunities for career growth and advancement.

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.

We are currently seeking an experienced Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. As a seasoned Data Analyst, you will guide junior analysts and collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

 

What You’ll Be Doing


Process big data volumes, modeling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (e.g. Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Finance)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products
Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governance strategies
Provide training and mentorship to junior team members, empowering them to excel in their contributions to the team’s projects
Develop sustainable processes and methodologies to support the effectiveness of our Data Analytics function


What You Bring


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Strong interest to mentor junior colleagues with enthusiasm and expertise
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment


It’s also a plus if you have…


Team leadership experience
Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML
Experience using ETL frameworks


What We Offer


A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.


This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

  • Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
  • Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products
  • Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governance strategies
  • Provide training and mentorship to junior team members, empowering them to excel in their contributions to the team’s projects
  • Develop sustainable processes and methodologies to support the effectiveness of our Data Analytics function

What You Bring

  • Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
  • Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
  • Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
  • Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
  • Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
  • Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
  • Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
  • Strong interest to mentor junior colleagues with enthusiasm and expertise
  • Capability to plan and implement projects independently
  • Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment

It’s also a plus if you have…

  • Team leadership experience
  • Prior music industry experience
  • Experience with GCP, dbt and Git
  • Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
  • Understanding of statistical methods and ML
  • Experience using ETL frameworks

What We Offer

  • A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
  • Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
  • Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
  • Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
  • A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
  • Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.

This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Title: Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
At Seven Senders, we connect people and markets, making international shipping a simple matter.

We are the leading platform for cross-border parcel delivery in Europe. We support e-commerce companies in successfully implementing their growth and internationalization plans and connecting millions of consumers with their desired products. Whether the focus is on speed or cost efficiency, we provide direct access to Europe's premier local carriers. Responsible for the daily end-to-end supply chain from the warehouse to the customer's doorstep, we ensure the parcels reach their destination efficiently and reliably.

Our mission is to connect markets with unparalleled ease using our innovative platform, which combines the best European delivery services with local logistics expertise. Since Johannes Plehn and Thomas Hagemann founded the company in Berlin in 2015, we've grown into a dedicated team of over 220 professionals. Today, we're proud to serve renowned clients such as ASOS, Shop Apotheke and Tamaris, continually advancing our journey as a European operating champion.



Job Description



At Seven Senders, our Business Intelligence team, led by Jimi Herrera, stands as the cornerstone of our data-driven ethos. We champion self-sufficient BI, fueling analytics and informed decisions with cutting-edge technology and streamlined workflows. We merge internal and external data from the 7S supply chain within our data hub, delivering enhanced intelligence and optimal automation to all stakeholders.


In this role, you will work closely with our data engineers to provide the best data models and collaborate with different stakeholders from the business on all levels to make data-driven decisions. You will be working to conduct a thorough analysis of large and complex data sets to extract meaningful insights.


The essence of your role

Develop and maintain robust data models, reports, and dashboards to analyze and visualize complex datasets.
Identify opportunities to improve processes and strategies with technology solutions.
Ensure quality control over data, analyses, and metrics.
Provide recommendations to the business by interpreting disparate data and translating ad hoc requests to deliver relevant and impactful results consistently.
Work closely with Data Engineers to provide the best data models.



Qualifications



This is what you need to succeed

+4 years of professional experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Analyst, or in a relevant field.
Excellent SQL skills with experience with cloud-based data warehouse solutions (Snowflake experience is a plus).
High proficiency in data visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Previous experience in e-commerce or logistics.
Proactive and solution-oriented attitude.



Additional Information



What we offer:

Flexible & Hybrid Work: Our office is at Alexanderplatz; we have a hybrid working model with flexible remote-office set-up and working hours. And if you wish, you can work from almost anywhere for up to 2 months per year.

Personal Growth: We want you to grow and develop your career with us. In addition to exciting opportunities, we offer a development platform with professional training programs and a culture that champions personal and career development.

Benefits: We offer a corporate benefits platform and German & English language courses.

Mission Zero: Climate-neutral and long-term impact. With our green initiatives, we are reaching climate neutrality for ourselves, and hopefully, we're inspiring the entire logistics sector to join us to create a sustainable future.

Vibrant Culture & Community: We embody collaboration, open doors, and no-fuss results focus, and we are successful with our data-driven and efficient working approach. We like to celebrate and come together, and we strive for a workplace buzzing with energy and camaraderie, highlighted by regular team events, BBQs, and company-wide celebrations.

Inclusive Environment: We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, or disability.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate




Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.

Job Requirements




Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Benefits




· Work up to 20 hours per week.

· Earn a competitive rate of pay.

· Develop your research skills.

· Avoid the long commute.

· Work from the comfort of your home office.

· Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Data & Analytics Lead
Description:
Pleo is the spending solution for forward-thinking teams. We empower employees of thousands of companies through smart virtual and physical cards and a modern expense management app. Cash is so old school. We want every employee to feel valued and trusted when spending money of your company. After all, if you're trusted enough to be hired, you should be trusted enough to spend money responsibly.

Pleo is hiring an Interim Data & Analytics Lead (12-month contract) in the Commercial Analytics Team in the Revenue Operations Domain to help take us to the next level!

The Commercial Analytics Team

The mission of the Commercial Analytics Teams in the commercial organisation is to enable senior leadership to take data-inspired actions and advance data literacy within the organisation. The Data & Analytics Lead in this team is responsible for ensuring data integrity of some of the most important KPIs across Pleo, empowering the talents in the team and to manage prioritisation and delivery.

What Great Looks Like In This Role


You and your team are company-wide trusted experts for insights related to the commercial KPIs (e.g. SaaS MRR, Commercial Pipeline metrics…)
You successfully nurture a culture of data-inspired decision-making in alignment with the other Data & Analytics leaders across the business
You are an ambassador for excellence within the Data & Analytics community, you lead by example and inspire others
You and your team empower senior (commercial) leadership to derive descriptive and diagnostic insights, while you focus on developing predictive and prescriptive insights
You and your team are highly satisfied in terms of career growth and your sense of belonging to the Revenue Operations domain and the Data & Analytics competence crew
You solve problems through collaboration rather than control. You are able to autonomously solve complex problems by being solution-driven and pragmatic
You are the go-to data & analytics partner for the commercial leadership team, you are able to guide strategic decision making with data insights, and identify opportunities where data & analytics solutions could make significant impact to the domain
You are able to translate business problems into technical requirements and challenges, and lead the scoping and implementation of the data analytics initiatives.


Your Responsibilities


Be the Data & Analytics Lead for up to 3 Data & Analytics professionals (One Analytics Engineer, two Data Analysts) of the Commercial Analytics Team, support their career growth efforts and provide coaching
Ensure Data & Analytics best practices and standards are identified, cultivated, and followed in your competence crew and domain, own the quality of work and provide ways of solving problems
Shape key metrics, key results, and data models domain as well as help the stakeholders in the domain get the most from the analytical resources
Spend up to 70% of your capacity on individual contribution and spearhead Data & Analytics projects in the commercial domains (Sales, Marketing, Partnerships)
Accountable for data quality, delivery and integrity in the Commercial Analytics Team, its readiness as well as accountability for data strategy roadmap and execution
Build impact through balancing speed and quality in your role


Your Colleagues Say You:


Have excellent hands-on knowledge of SQL and experience with advanced analytics and data science topics such as regression and clustering analysis
Are experienced with data visualisation tools such as Looker or similar
Excellent written and verbal commercialization skills, able to communicate with clarity and empathy on insights and recommendations to senior stakeholders
Are experienced in analysing large amount of complex data sources, able to clearly synthesise the key learnings and provide actionable recommendations
Are an authentic, experienced leader and a role model for radical candor
Are proactive and have a strong sense of ownership and drive
Are adaptable and open to find new ways of problem solving
Truly enjoy helping others grow and shine


Show me the benefits!


Your own Pleo card (no more out-of-pocket spending!)
Lunch is on us - with catering in our Lisbon, Copenhagen and London offices or a monthly lunch allowance paid directly together with your salary in other markets 🍜
Private health insurance to ensure you’re fit in body and mind to do your best work
We offer 25 days of holiday + your public holidays (according to your location)
We offer flexibility/remote working options
Option to purchase 5 additional days of holiday through a salary sacrifice
Wellbeing days - fully paid days off designed for a slower pace, allowing you to take time to recharge and prioritise self-care
We’re trialling MyndUp to give our employees access to free mental health and wellbeing support with great success so far ❤️‍🩹
Access to LinkedIn Learning - acquire new skills, stay abreast of industry trends and fuel your personal and professional development continuously
Paid parental leave - we want to make sure that we're supportive of families and help you feel that you don't have to compromise your family due to work 👶
All of us have a stake in Pleo’s success - ask us about our equity grant scheme


Why join us?

Working at Pleo means you're working on something very exciting: the future of work. Our mission is to help every company go beyond the books. Pleo itself means ‘more than you’d expect’, and it’s been the secret to our success over the last 8 years. So it’s only fitting that we’d pass this philosophy onto our customers to help them make the most of their finances.

We think company spending should be delegated to all employees and teams, that it should be as automated as possible, and that it should drive a culture of responsible spending. Finance teams shouldn’t be siloed from the rest of the organisation – they should work in unity with marketing, sales, IT and everyone else.

Speaking of working in unity, our values tell the story of how we work at Pleo. We have four core values, the first of which is ‘champion the customer’, which means we address real pain points that businesses face. Next up is ‘succeed as a team’, which highlights how our strength lies in our diversity and trust in each other. We also ‘make it happen’ by taking bold decisions and following through to deliver results. Last but not least, we ‘build to scale’, creating lasting solutions that address today’s challenges and anticipate tomorrow’s needs.

So, in a nutshell, that's Pleo. Today we are a 850+ team, from over 100 nations, sitting in our Copenhagen HQ, London, Stockholm, Berlin, Madrid, Montreal and Lisbon offices —and quite a few full-time remotes in 35 other countries! Being HQ'd out of Copenhagen means we're inspired by things like a good work-life balance. If you don't work in the office with us, we'll help you set up the best remote setup possible and make sure you still have time to connect with your team.

About Your Application


Please submit your application in English; it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join 💕
We treat all candidates equally: If you are interested please apply through our application system - any correspondence should come from there! Our lovely support isn't able to pass on any calls/ emails our way - and this makes sure that the candidate experience is smooth and fair to everyone 😊
We’re on a mission to make everyone feel valued at work. That’s only achievable if our team reflects the diversity of the world around us - and that starts with you, hitting apply, even if you are worried you might not tick all the boxes! We embrace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply - regardless of race/ethnicity, colour, religion, nationality, gender, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, socio-economic status, culture or beliefs
When you submit an application we process your personal data as a data processor. Find out more about how your data is used in the FAQs section at the bottom of our jobs page
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Vendor Sales & Operations (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join the Vendor Sales & Operations - Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The sustainable acquisition of good quality restaurants is a crucial part of Delivery Hero’s profitability goal. We focus on: what to acquire, where, how should we prioritize the backlog of leads, what channel is better for us to prioritize investments on our side, how do we enhance the vendor experience in the onboarding process, etc.

We focus on global initiative, and our main stakeholders are global product and business teams that are also focused on restaurant acquisition.

Your Mission:


Owning end to end the analytics part on multiple projects for the Vendor management team (this can vary from Competitor intelligence, VRM, Grading, AMC)
We focus on delivering data projects and adding value with actionable insights that help the business and product teams


What you need to be successful

Your Heroic Skills


Passion for data, problem-solving and generating actionable insights that impact the business
Highly proficient in SQL
Proficient in Data visualization and storytelling
Team player and ability to think outside the box
Communication skills
Business understanding


Nice to have:


Experience with process orchestrators (preferably DBT+Airflow)
Experience in AB Testing
Practical experience working with Git (or similar version control system)


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.
