Teil des Traineeprogramms werden z.B. fachliche und technologische Trainings, Schulungen und Arbeitsmethoden sein, welche mit einer SAP-Zertifizierung abschließen.

Analytics – Du leitest aus den Geschäftsprozessen die Anforderungen an die Business-Analytics-Lösungen ab und entwickelst ganzheitliche Anwendungen. Unsere Beratungsteams begleiten in allen Phasen der Projektrealisierung: Von der Anforderungs- und Bedarfsanalyse über die Erstellung betriebswirtschaftlicher Konzepte, bis zur Realisierung und Implementierung.

Beratungsfunktion – Wir beraten unsere Kunden in den Themen rund um SAP Business and Analytics, SAP Business Intelligence, SAP S/4HANA (Embedded Analytics) und SAP HANA Cloud.

Datenanalyse – Mit Werkzeugen aus den Bereichen Big Data, Predictive Analytics, Business AI, Cloud Computing, Business Analytics und Business Intelligence deckst du das gesamte Spektrum der Datenanalyse ab.

Das bringst du mit

  • Dein Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, der Wirtschaftswissenschaften, des Ingenieurwesens, der Mathematik, der Statistik oder eines verwandten Fachbereichs hast du erfolgreich abgeschlossen oder stehst kurz davor.
  • Du bist begeistert davon, dich mit den Feldern Business and Analytics und Business AI auseinanderzusetzen und in diesem Umfeld Lösungen mit unseren Kunden zu entwickeln.
  • Idealerweise kannst du erste Erfahrungen in Form von Praktika oder Werkstundententätigkeiten im Bereich Business and Analytics oder Business AI vorweisen.
  • Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift bringst du mit.
  • Das Traineeprogramm startet zum 01.10.2024 und 01.04.2025.

Deine Benefits

Flexibilität – Deine Arbeitszeit und deinen Arbeitsort kannst du bei uns - in Abstimmung mit den betrieblichen Anforderungen und arbeitsrechtlichen Bestimmungen - selber bestimmen. Dabei gibt es keine Kernarbeitszeiten und du hast die Möglichkeit, im Home Office sowie in über 40 Ländern zu arbeiten.

Masterförderung – Durch unsere interne Academy, internationale Erfahrungen durch Secondments und kontinuierliches Mentoring entwickelst du dich stetig weiter. Darüber hinaus bieten wir die Möglichkeit einer Masterförderung für Examensmaster und Spezialisierungsmaster an.

Freizeit – Dank eines Teilzeit-Blockmodells kannst du auch mehrmonatige Auszeiten in Form eines Sabbaticals nehmen. Zusätzlich kannst du bei PwC Deutschland Überstunden auf einem persönlichen Jahresarbeitszeitkonto sammeln. Dabei bleibt es dir überlassen, ob du dir deine Überstunden auszahlen lässt oder flexibel in mehr Freizeit umwandelst.

Gesundheit – Deine Gesundheit liegt uns am Herzen: Neben einer eigenen betrieblichen Krankenkasse bieten wir auch Vorsorgeuntersuchungen sowie Sportangebote an. Nimm an unserem kostenlosen Betriebssportprogramm teil oder profitiere von vergünstigten Beiträgen in diversen Fitnessstudios oder einer Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft.

– Wir möchten ein positives Arbeitsumfeld schaffen: Ein Umfeld, in dem flexibles und kreatives Arbeiten möglich ist, in dem Arbeit anerkannt und Leistung honoriert wird und auf das wir stolz sind. Alle Benefits findest du auf unserer Karriereseite.

Bei PwC Deutschland arbeiten wir daran, entscheidende Herausforderungen zu lösen, nachhaltige Ergebnisse zu schaffen und das Vertrauen in die Wirtschaft und Gesellschaft auszubauen. Als Teil unseres Finance Transformation Teams unterstützt du Unternehmen dabei, ihre Finanzabteilung zu einem noch stärkeren Businesspartner zu machen und so die Wettbewerbsfähigkeit des gesamten Unternehmens schneller voranzutreiben. Dabei ist unser Themenspektrum breit: Von CFO-Strategie über Process Excellence, ERP-Systemen, Quality Assurance, Compliance und Data Management. Dabei stellen wir als integriertes Finance Transformation-Team das reibungslose Ineinandergreifen aller Teilprojekte entlang der gesamten Wertschöpfungskette sicher.

Kontakt

Du hast Fragen zu dieser Position oder deiner Bewerbung?

Melde dich gerne bei Theresa Volders unter +49 1515 4092298.

Title: Lead Data Engineer
Description:
AI Futures are engaged with a leading energy company in their search for a Lead Data Engineer. This position is on a permanent basis and will act as a technical lead within the data function, supporting a team of data engineers with solution design and implementing best practices.




This company are investing heavily into Data & AI, and have buy-in from the CEO to expand their data capability, with enterprise grade data products. They are also heavily invested into environmentally friendly topics, making a positive impact on the planet and are expanding their offering of innovative green fuels for the future.




Candidates should demonstrate the following experience:

Technical Leadership, ideally within Data Engineering functions
Azure cloud data services (Data Factory, Azure Functions etc)
Databricks
Python & SQL
CI / CD & DevOps knowledge
Excellent Data Architecture & Design experience




This is a fantastic opportunity to join a leader in the GreenTech & Energy space, and you will have the opportunity to progress in your role and become a leader within the data team.




Successful candidates will receive an excellent salary of up to €110k (incl. bonuses) and a comprehensive benefits package. The company also offer flexible working arrangements and candidates can expect to work in the office 2-3x per month.




If this role is of interest, please reach out to be considered for immediate interview slots.

Title: Analytics Engineer (d/f/m) at Solaris
Description:
Solaris is a tech company with a full German banking license. Our Banking-as-a-Service platform enables businesses to offer their own financial products. With our straightforward APIs, our partners can access and integrate a wide range of solutions such as digital banking, payments, cards, identification and lending services. As a market leader we are driven by bringing transformational change to the financial services industry.

We love what we do and we love our team. We are 700+ people from over 70 nationalities - a unique blend of techies, fintech enthusiasts, bankers and entrepreneurs from various industries. Our routines are built around genuinely valuing and exchanging different perspectives as well as actively sharing knowledge as we drive our business as a team. We believe and invest in personal growth.

Your Role


Designs data models for the business processes in collaboration with the embedded teams
Provide clean and transformed data with meaningful insights,
Apply data engineering best practices to the analytics code
Perform complex analysis of source data
Develops and maintains 3rd party tool integrations
Enables the business stakeholders by automating tasks and producing critical KPIs
Increase the data quality, the observability, the discoverability and the documenting of our data products
Lead and participate in cross-functional projects that support analytical and operational usage of the data
Develop datasets for very specific custom 3rd party tools



We'd love to see

Depending on your level of experience, your responsibilities and scope of role will range. We don’t care much about fancy titles, but rather about real personal and professional development, as laid out in our learning framework. Let’s figure together out how you can contribute to our team.


You are very proficient with SQL and familiar with Python
You are knowledgeable in Finance and Risk Analytics
You have at least 3 years of professional experience in designing data pipelines and analysing large datasets
You understand agile workflows and lean principles
You communicate well in written and verbal English



Benefits


We have a "remote-friendly" working arrangement
Home office budget
Learning and development budget
Transparent framework to support your career goals
Competitive salary



While job ads usually paint an ideal picture of a candidate, studies show that most applicants meet an average of 60% of the criteria. Unfortunately, many promising candidates tend to apply only if they meet all the criteria. So if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single item in the job description, please contact us anyway. We'd love to talk with you and find out if you might be a good fit for us.

At Solaris, we are committed to nurturing an inclusive environment, where all Solarians feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a diverse workforce that reflects the diversity of our communities. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of color, ethnicity, religion, sex, origin, disability, marital status, citizenship, or gender identity. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.Information on data processing:

DE: https://www.solarisgroup.com/gdpr_notice_de

EN: https://www.solarisgroup.com/gdpr_notice_en

To all recruitment agencies: Solaris does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Solaris employees or any other venture in our ecosystem. Solaris is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
We’re looking for curious analysts interested in being considered for a Data Analyst role in the Advanced Analytics team and who are buzzing to solve impactful questions for exciting products in the online dating industry and beyond.

In this role, you’ll support our stakeholders with data and insights related to a variety of business areas. You’ll be involved in experimentation design and planning, visualisations, trend diagnostics, dashboarding and much, much more.

What You’ll Do


You’ll have access to the most diverse, varied and complex data sets in the technology world right now (10’s of billions of data points per day!!)
You’ll be doing all the typical day-to-day tasks such as generating practical insights from the data, manipulating complex datasets, and helping us understand how to improve and optimise our member's experience to facilitate the creation of meaningful, equitable and healthy relationships
Unlock your potential by upskilling in statistics, Python and other essential tools, empowering you to expand your skill set and excel in your career.
You will help uncover tactical and strategic insights and support experimentation across all areas of the product development lifecycle. You will use SQL and data visualisation skills to translate technical problems into actionable recommendations for product managers.
You will make contributions to the data model and contribute to building out data pipelines
You’ll collaborate closely with several potential teams including Product Managers, strategists, analytics managers, and analytics engineers PLUS, you’ll be building detailed, entrepreneurial and business-minded insights that directly contribute to the successful growth of Bumble Inc.


About You


Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Business, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related discipline.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to work with complex datasets.
Foundational coding experience (e.g. SQL. Python, R, Matlab, SAS, Java)
Experience with data visualisation
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methods.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present findings to non-technical audiences.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Detail-oriented mindset and a strong commitment to accuracy.
Internships, coursework, or projects involving data analysis or business intelligence are a plus.
Eagerness to learn and develop new skills in data analysis and business insights.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Bbc Studios

BBC Studios is a world-renowned content studio and channels & streaming business, powered by British creativity, with a reach that touches audiences in every corner of the globe.

We work with outstanding creative talent who are responsible for platform-defining shows from Strictly Come Dancing to Bluey, Prehistoric Planet to Planet Earth III.

The range and quality of our content is unsurpassed, creating critical and commercial successes and global phenomena.

From BAFTAs to RTS Awards, BBC Studios is Britain’s most awarded production company and the only producer with three of the top ten shows on IMDB; we’re the home of bbc.com, the widest-read English language news website in the world; and the UK’s largest distributor of British content.

THE ROLE

As a Data Governance Analyst, you will play a crucial role in structuring and governing our data to drive meaningful actions and insights. By establishing a robust data domain and ownership model, you will empower teams to maximise the value derived from our data.

Specifically, You Will Be Responsible For These Activities


Leading on the development of the Data Ownership and Domain Model for BBC Studios.
Establishing and enforcing data governance standards and best practices across domains, promoting data governance awareness and fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making.
Develop a pragmatic approach to understanding BBC Studios complex organisational structure and implementing the best solution.
Promoting data governance disciplines and culture internally, educating the business on analytics, reporting, data management and creating accessible documentation which is widely shared and understood.
Assigning accountability and responsibility for the data to the domain owners and senior stakeholders across the business.
Provide advice and support to the key stakeholders when ownership is assigned through Data Governance Committees.
Use data tools, reporting, and knowledge sharing to democratise data across the company.
Collaborating with Platform teams to ensure data governance principles are integrated into data systems, applications, and infrastructure.


WHAT DOES IT TAKE?

Key criteria


Experience as an business analyst role or equivalent.
Proven experience developing and / or implementing data domain ownership model in a complex organisation.
Experience of operational risk management
Experience working with 3rd party vendors
Influencing skills and ability to build effective relationships across business, technical, and governance functions.
Experience working collaboratively across a diverse set of stakeholders
Expert knowledge of data management
Experience in domain structures and ownership models.


Desirable Skills


Experience working hands-on with big data systems / complex dataset management and high-level programming languages such as SQL and data visualisation tools (Tableau, PowerBI or similar)
Commercial experience.
Experience with agile or other rapid application development methods
A mix of public sector and commercial experience
Knowledge of different data programming or structured querying languages


LIFE AT BBC STUDIOS

We don’t focus simply on what we do – we also care how we do it. Our values and the way we behave are important to us. Please make sure you’ve read about our values and behaviours here.

The BBC is committed to building a culturally diverse workforce and therefore strongly encourages applications from underrepresented groups. We are committed to equality of opportunity and welcome applications from individuals, regardless of their background. More information on our D&I plan can be found here.

BBC Studios puts sustainability at the heart of everything we do both onscreen and offscreen, including delivering against the BBC Group’s science-based Net Zero targets. More information on sustainability at BBC Studios can be found here.

We are proud to share that we are a Level 2 Disability Confident Employer and we strongly encourage applications from disabled people . If you meet the minimum criteria for this role and declare that you are disabled, we will ensure to advance you to the next stage (minimum criteria above).

If you require any reasonable adjustments in order to apply please contact us on reasonable.adjustments@bbc.co.uk.

What Will You Gain From Working At Bbc Studios


Flexible 35-hour working week for work-life balance
26 days holiday (plus an additional day which is a Corporation Day) with the option to buy an extra 5 days
A defined pension scheme and discounted dental, health care, gym and much more
Excellent career progression – access to courses, webinars, workshops and the opportunity to work in different areas of the organisation


Package Description

Job Reference: 17244

Band: C

Salary: £35,000 - £42,000 depending on relevant skills, knowledge and experience plus London Weighting Allowance. The expected salary range for this role reflects internal benchmarking and external market insights.
Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Role - Junior Data Analyst

Location - London

Salary - £30k-£45k (DOE)




Join a revolutionary Financial services company based in the heart of London. Helping over 200,000 business across the UK and Europe overcome challenging events and increase profits.




They are looking for a Junior Data Analyst who is passionate about finance and leveraging data to drive business decisions. You will play a crucial role in analysing financial data sets, generating actionable insights, and supporting business operations through data-driven analysis.




Responsibilities:

Analyse raw financial data: assess quality, cleanse, and structure for downstream processing.
Generate accurate and insightful reports to support financial forecasting and market analysis.
Collaborate closely with the finance team to support analytical projects and business initiatives.
Provide actionable insights for business improvements based on data analysis.
Build interactive dashboards for senior stakeholders and clients to provide actionable insights.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a STEM field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance, etc.).
Basic understanding of data analysis techniques, statistical methods, and data visualisation.
Proficiency in a programming language (Python, SQL) for data analysis and reporting tasks.
Familiarity with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) for handling and visualising financial datasets.




Additional Skills (Preferred):

Experience working with financial data or related domains.
Knowledge of financial market dynamics and trends.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Passion for learning and staying updated with the latest advancements in data analysis and finance technology.




Benefits:

Competitive salary package.
Annual Bonus
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and innovative finance environment.
Access to cutting-edge technologies and tools for data analysis.
Career development and growth opportunities within the company.




We would love to hear from you if you are a motivated Junior Data Analyst with a passion for finance and data-driven decision-making. Apply now to join our team and help shape the finance industry's future.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - TikTok LIVE - London
Description:
Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touchpoints to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in data analysis
- Strong mathematical skills to measure, collect, and analyze data
- Proficiency in statistics and experience using data visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker
- Knowledge of SQL and any programming languages
- Attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
- Bachelor’s degree in STEM (science, technology, engineering, math); Advanced Degrees are preferred
- Python is highly preferred
- Attention to detail

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more
HTML:
Responsibilities

 TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. Our focus is to continually champion and optimize TikTok LIVE through working with creators to ensure a creative, fun and safe space for all of our users.

The Regional LIVE Operation Strategy Team leads various cross-functional projects. Our key initiatives include developing strategic plans to drive widespread adoption of LIVE at scale among creators, localizing new product features, creating user engagement strategies, ensuring a positive creator experience through education on the Community Guidelines and best practices, and providing ad hoc analysis and support to cross-functional partners.

Responsibilities:
- Analyzing local and global trends to help improve performance within the EU LIVE team
- Creating and preparing reports and dashboards to help us better identify areas of focus and trends within our ecosystem

Examples of Problems You'll Be Solving:
- What are the best content verticals for us to focus our creator recruitment on?
- Building a prediction model for identifying creators who may be destined for success on our platform
- Which metrics and leading and lagging indicators should we use for our key OKRs?
- How should we best segment our creators and users to have a more meaningful impact on their growth?
- What are the best touchpoints to educate our creators, and when should we activate this education?
- Using statistical tools to simplify complex data sets, helping us better diagnose issues and propose solutions

Qualifications

 Minimum Qualifications:
- Minimum 3 years of working experience in data analysis
- Strong mathematical skills to measure, collect, and analyze data
- Proficiency in statistics and experience using data visualization software such as Tableau, PowerBI, or Looker
- Knowledge of SQL and any programming languages
- Attention to detail

Preferred Qualifications:
- Bachelor’s degree in STEM (science, technology, engineering, math); Advanced Degrees are preferred
- Python is highly preferred
- Attention to detail

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
Bumble Inc. is seeking a skilled Product Analyst to collaborate with senior business stakeholders and product managers in providing data-driven insights across all stages of the product development lifecycle. This role will focus on experimentation, statistical analysis, data modelling and visualisation, as well as in-depth product analyses. This is a unique opportunity for an experienced analyst who enjoys a fast-paced environment and has a passion for contributing to helping the Bumble Inc. mission to foster kind connections.

Key Accountabilities


Be an analytical thought partner to a cross-functional team of engineers, designers and product managers. This will include providing analytical support across all areas of the product development lifecycle, from ideation and broad product strategy to analytics deep dives and experimentation.
You will lead experimentation across an area of the product. You will design and execute multi-step experiments to understand the impact of a feature or product change on user behaviour and business KPIs. You will interpret experiment results and translate them into actionable recommendations for a non-technical audience.
You will own event tracking for one area of the app, understanding which events are critical to track user behaviour.
You will create self-serve dashboards to ensure stakeholders have access to real-time insights.
You will provide actionable insights on product strategy and recommendations to your stakeholders, automating decision-making where applicable and providing tools and solutions that help enable self-service and scalability.
You will develop deep knowledge of the product domain, becoming an authority on its characteristics, drivers, and subsystems.
You will contribute to data quality related to the domain, proactively working with Data and Analytics Eng. and other teams to improve data collection and modelling.
You will create an environment of utilising data for planning and execution, always keeping in mind alternative and creative solutions to performance measurement across a variety of product initiatives.


Required Experience & Skills


Preference for a graduate degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Information Sciences, Economics, Finance, or STEM. PhD and Masters welcome.
You will have experience using SQL and python to solve data science, statistical and analytics problems.
I prefer experience working in similar dating, social, or gaming tech product industries or in financial services or high-data-volume industries.
You have experience working in a highly collaborative cross functional space and translating technical insights for a non-technical audience.
You have experience setting up experimentation, statistical measurement, and data collection in the product domain.
Strong experience creating data visualisations and self serve tools for a product forced audience.
You keep an eye out on the industry, understanding how the wider dating industry influences our product strategy.
You have experience working with complex data infrastructures and have experience partnering and guiding the work of data engineering to help facilitate ingestion, warehousing, and optimisation of databases.
3+ years experience in product analytics analytics, being able to elaborate on the business impact you have driven in your previous experience.


About You


Strong believer in Bumble Inc.’s brand vision and values
Engaging, inspiring and clear communicator. A proven track record of socialising and embedding analytical findings to drive business outcomes.
Understands and can demonstrate a data science skillset and use advanced analytical tools and visualisations to produce impact in an organisation.
Deep commercial understanding and a proven ability to create impact through the power of customer-led insights.
Comfort in operating in ambiguous and complex problem spaces, and helping cross functional teams to define the questions that help support product development.
A love of collaborating with colleagues and stakeholders to arrive at rounded and balanced perspectives in your work, a strong desire to learn from others
Commercially minded, with a keen sense of where insights can fuel growth.
Strong experience with python/SQL, visualisation tooling such as Looker/Tableau, and machine learning/data science tooling such as Streamlit/Count/Kubeflow.
Strong governance and data quality mindset.
Show more

Title: CRM Data Analyst, EMEI
Description:
The purpose of the CRM Data Analyst, EMEI role is to contribute to optimizing customer interactions and business growth for the Brand.




The CRM Data Analyst, EMEI will play a crucial role in the Maison to leverage our client data to enhance our customer engagement and ultimately foster loyalty to the Brand.




The successful candidate will analyse client behavioural data, performance metrics, market trends and CRM system performance. They will support on the creation and monitoring of client initiatives to enhance business outcomes and improve client engagement.




They will use this insight to help devise strategies and approaches to target our clients to drive sales and enhance the overall client experience.




This position will partner and collaborate cross functionally, including Retail, Operations, Ecommerce, Product, Communications, Events, Merchandising and Planning and Training functions.




Prior experience in CRM and Luxury Retail is advantageous.




The CRM Analyst, EMEI will report directly to the Planning Director, EMEI with multiple key stakeholder relationships across the region.




Key Responsibilities

Development of CRM Analysis

Assess the need and create new KPIs to be able to allow the teams to learn our customers behaviour

Strategic Analysis: Prepare key analysis for the Brand, including monthly and annual reports for the top management. Utilize BI tools to perform hands-on analysis, delivering customer insights across Retail, ECOM, and Buying & Planning.

Monthly Customer business reports (customer typology & customer category) at various level (region, stores)

Customer behavior analysis with product categories and seasonality

Customer and Transactional cross selling analysis

Reporting and KPIs: Develop custom reporting, dashboards, and identify additional KPIs to drive business decisions.

Close collaboration with central CRM team to contribute in creating centralised reports in powerBI

Create an analytical mindset in the retail and ecommerce teams

Data quality monitoring: Oversee client data for the UK and European region.
Segmentation Optimization: Analyse and challenge existing segmentations.

Analysis of CRM Performance

Collection Launch Support: Provide analytical assistance during collection launches, pop ups and new store openings.

Evaluate the effectiveness of CRM and clientelling campaigns and contribute with ideas for enhancements or improvements.

Customer Insights: Collaborate with Retail and Digital teams to analyse customer behavior and demographics. Identify critical client insights, target groups, and evaluate clientelling, events, and marketing initiatives.

Client Engagement Insights: Support all aspects of Client Engagement by analysing performance, ROI for events, and customer-centric insights.

Skillset

Clear Communication: Translate data research into concise, compelling insights through verbal and visual presentations.
Industry Research: Conduct research on clients and the luxury industry.
Holistic Analysis: Integrate and analyze client data from quantitative and qualitative sources.
Collaboration with Paris HQ: Work with the central team to organise workshops for future reports and any other ad hoc projects to enhance departmental performance.
Creativity and Accuracy: Blend innovative approaches while ensuring report accuracy and consistency.




Attributes

A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a similar position
Proficient in Microsoft Excel
Excellent command of Power BI
Strong written and oral communication skills
Ability to travel as needed
Passion for Christian Louboutin and a true ambassador for the brand with strong sense of responsibility
Ideal candidate has work experience in medium sized multinational company or luxury business
Additional language fluency is a plus
Adheres to company policy and confidentiality
Proactively contributes to creating a team atmosphere that is professional, flexible and enjoyable
Exudes a “no task is too big or too small” attitude, with initiative, commitment, reliability, and positivity. Does not accept mediocrity
Versatile; embraces change and is consistently able to develop and adapt to the needs of the business.
Driven to learn and grow
Grasps new concepts quickly, prioritizes efficiently and is organized
Exceptional customer service skills along with transparent and effective interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
Strong follow up, follow through and attention to detail to ensure deadlines are met




Our Business:

Christian Louboutin opened his first boutique in Paris in 1992. An artist and craftsman with a true passion for shoes, his designs are unique and instantly recognizable, thanks in part to their signature and now trademarked red lacquered soles. The collections for both men and women combine wit, glamour, elegance and technical proficiency like no other. 2014 welcomed the launched of Christian Louboutin Beaute with its first nail colour, Rouge Louboutin. The collection has continued to diversify since then with the launch of lip in 2015, fragrance in 2016 and more recently a wonderful eye collection in 2017. With an extensive range of collections, Christian Louboutin now counts more than 130 boutiques globally.




Our people are at the heart of our brand. We celebrate individuality and allow the freedom to have responsibility, autonomy and creativity within your role. Our colleagues have in common the passion and dedication to our Brand, and its continued success.




Our Values:

We are down to earth – we stand with authenticity, integrity and respect.

We have passion – we drive the business with agility and care and we are committed to excellence.

We have happiness in all that we do – As a team player, we collaborate with positivity, open-mindedness and fun.

We work with inspiration – we envision the future with confidence, creativity and freedom.




If the shoe fits, walk with us…




Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:

The Maison Christian Louboutin is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to recruitment practices that do not discriminate against any job applicant because of their race, color, gender, age, nationality, culture(s), religion, sex, physical or mental disability, or age. We believe that a culture of diversity and individuality fosters our core values we listed above. So, if you also share this mindset and these values and you dream of coloring your soles red as part of the Louboutin adventure, please join us!




*Please note:

By submitting your CV and application information to Christian Louboutin UK Ltd for the above role, you hereby consent to be contacted by email and/or by telephone in relation to this recruitment process by the HR, Northern Europe Team.

Christian Louboutin UK Ltd respects your privacy and your desire to understand how your information will be handled and used. For more information on our how we collect, use and store your information, please refer to our Privacy Notice: http://eu.christianlouboutin.com/uk_en/policy

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
About Inigo




We enable your ambition. We insure good people – knowledgably, fairly, and efficiently. We combine our expertise with the best of science, data, and analytics.




Inigo's aim is to create an underwriting focused insurance and reinsurance business, concentrating on limited classes. We want to combine the best data and analytics that exist and build our own capability to generate insights to drive business decisions. At the top of our agenda is to create a diverse and open culture where we foster talent and provide opportunities to build a rewarding career in a company that is vibrant and at the start of an exciting journey.

We have a culture that is inclusive, fun, and constantly strives for excellence, we describe it as ‘all in’. Our values are:




Get Smart – we ask questions, explore, learn, and continuously strive for excellence
Park the Ego – we are welcoming and open, and embrace different thinking
Share the Passion – we collaborate and communicate our expertise honestly and thoughtfully
Radical Simplicity – we are transparent, focused and actively avoid complexity in how we operate




Aim of the role




The aim of the role is to support the actuarial reserving team as well as the finance team. The candidate will work closely with the actuarial and finance teams to support various analytical tasks, including data collection, cleansing, and analysis. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI, and the ability to communicate findings effectively.




The successful candidate will do this by:




Being the data manager and extracting, treating and cleansing data in order to have accurate and complete data for the reserving and finance process
Identifying and addressing data quality issues, including correcting data errors and capturing missing business information
Automating tasks in Alteryx or Power BI
Maintaining current Alteryx and Power BI models
Identifying opportunities to streamline data processes and enhance data quality though process and model improvements
Validating and reconciling data across multiple systems and providing reports to actuaries and management
Ensuring the data tools provide appropriate, complete and accurate data
Working with IT so they are aware of changes to tools and databases that may impact corporate systems or databases
Providing data to different stakeholders (Reserving, Pricing, Capital, Finance)




In addition to the above key responsibilities, you may be required to undertake other duties from time to time as the Company may reasonably require.




To do this, we’re going to need you to bring:




Experience in data analysis for Non-Life business
Experience with dealing with large amount of data
High proficiency in Alteryx and Power BI
Strong attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of individuals in a variety of functions (e.g. finance, claims, underwriting, actuarial, operations)
Ability to deliver results under tight deadlines
Good problem-solving abilities

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Deliveroo Finance is delivering a transformation programme to ensure the teams, processes and systems across Finance are optimally configured to best support the company in the execution of its strategy to achieve growth and profitability. The role will report into the Senior Finance Business Analyst supporting Finance systems, data and process for a number of projects within this programme.

What You’ll Be Doing



Developing a detailed master data strategy and plan
Mapping data sets to master data + cleansing/enriching/transformation requirements
Collating and enriching data in line with agreed data standards
Undertaking data comparison’s on large data sets using SQL
Conducting data collection, cleansing, mapping, and re-formatting activities
Validating and reconciling data loads to confirm data integrity
Developing resolutions to problems, using sharp judgement to develop methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria to enable delivery of solutions



Requirements

Key competencies/skills:



Prior experience in Snowflake, Looker, SQL
Experience in Financial systems
Quantitative knowledge and skills, training in maths and statistics;
Experience in leading data science projects and delivering from end to end;
Experience in data management and data analysis in relational databases and in the latest 3rd party data analytics software;
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent problem solving and critical thinking capabilities
Strong understanding of concepts and Technologies including data transfer mechanisms
Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences
Collaborative nature to share knowledge with peers
Applying a Structured Approach - able to ensure best practice approach, bringing a ‘toolkit’ of templates.
Big Picture Vision - to zoom out from what is currently done and see why it is we need to do it. Able to quickly draw parallels and consolidate activities from diverse activities.
Analytical Mindset - to break down monolithic problems into clearly distinct and digestible issues and then identify options to resolve them.
Stakeholder Partnership - to engage, influence and excite a varied team from across multiple business units and help instil a joint feeling of ownership and pride.
Effective Communicator - to build and sustain effective communications with the project team and end-users. Ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences.
Flexible Approach - tailor expert knowledge to meet specific circumstances.



Why Deliveroo?

Our mission is to be the definitive food company. We are transforming the way the world eats by making food more convenient and accessible. We give people the opportunity to eat what they want, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Benefits And Diversity

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth, time away and relocation.

We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing startups in an incredibly exciting space.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

  • Collating and enriching data in line with agreed data standards
  • Undertaking data comparison’s on large data sets using SQL
  • Conducting data collection, cleansing, mapping, and re-formatting activities
  • Validating and reconciling data loads to confirm data integrity
  • Developing resolutions to problems, using sharp judgement to develop methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria to enable delivery of solutions


Requirements

Key competencies/skills:


  • Prior experience in Snowflake, Looker, SQL
  • Experience in Financial systems
  • Quantitative knowledge and skills, training in maths and statistics;
  • Experience in leading data science projects and delivering from end to end;
  • Experience in data management and data analysis in relational databases and in the latest 3rd party data analytics software;
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent problem solving and critical thinking capabilities
  • Strong understanding of concepts and Technologies including data transfer mechanisms
  • Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audiences
  • Collaborative nature to share knowledge with peers
  • Applying a Structured Approach - able to ensure best practice approach, bringing a ‘toolkit’ of templates.
  • Big Picture Vision - to zoom out from what is currently done and see why it is we need to do it. Able to quickly draw parallels and consolidate activities from diverse activities.
  • Analytical Mindset - to break down monolithic problems into clearly distinct and digestible issues and then identify options to resolve them.
  • Stakeholder Partnership - to engage, influence and excite a varied team from across multiple business units and help instil a joint feeling of ownership and pride.
  • Effective Communicator - to build and sustain effective communications with the project team and end-users. Ability to clearly articulate messages to a variety of audiences.
  • Flexible Approach - tailor expert knowledge to meet specific circumstances.


Why Deliveroo?

Our mission is to be the definitive food company. We are transforming the way the world eats by making food more convenient and accessible. We give people the opportunity to eat what they want, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Benefits And Diversity

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth, time away and relocation.

We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing startups in an incredibly exciting space.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Location: North London / Home

12 Month Fixed Term Contract

Salary: £25,000 - £28,000 (+ benefits)




Skills / Experience: MS Access, Word, Excel, Attention to detail, Interest in Politics / Democracy




We are looking to recruit a Data Analyst for a global software and solutions organisation. You will be a self-motivated individual who excels at working with a high level of detail in a diverse, and often time-critical environment. Working with high volumes of electoral data you will be responsible for collating and processing votes from my client's postal scanning and electronic systems, ensuring the integrity of elections.




This is an initial 12 month fixed term contract and an excellent role for someone with an interest in politics / elections looking for their first data focused position.




The role is hybrid with 2 days a week on site at my client's office in North London.




Principal Accountabilities:




Data Processing:




Import, process, and query vote data using MS Access and SQL Server.
Produce accurate election result, summary, and breakdown reports within project schedules.
Support the project manager to deliver the highest quality of service to my client's customers.




Project Management:

Handle multiple projects simultaneously, requiring critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Create and adapt basic queries and procedures to identify issues and manipulate data effectively.




Team Collaboration:

Assist with the management and delivery of team objectives, contributing to the overall strategy of the team and business unit.
Actively participate in reviewing and improving sector and company procedures and software.




Essential Competencies:




Technical Skills:

Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, particularly MS Access, Excel, and Word.
Good knowledge of Windows operating systems, file formats, and data conversion issues.
Previous experience with databases, especially MS Access or SQL Server Management Studio, and working with large data sets is preferred.




Experience:

Experience in a project-based environment is advantageous.
Direct customer interaction experience is a plus.
Awareness of various voting systems (e.g., First Past the Post, Single Transferable Vote, Proxy voting) is beneficial.




Attention to Detail:

Excellent attention to detail with the ability to maintain accuracy under pressure within tight deadlines.




Communication Skills:

Well-developed communication skills with the confidence to liaise with both technical and non-technical audiences across all levels of the company and with customers.




Time Management:

Strong time-management skills; hard-working, flexible, and able to oversee multiple jobs from start to finish within given timeframes.




Self-Motivation:

Self-motivated with the ability to plan, complete, and document projects with minimal supervision while seeking the right advice when required.




Teamwork:

Desire and experience of working as part of a team.
Creative approach to problem-solving and a curiosity and willingness to learn.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Product Analyst

£60,000

London (1 or 2 days p/w)




I've partnered with a business intelligence business that work in the Legal sector. They are looking for a Data Analyst, who will sit within the Product function, to help drive their digital and web analytics capability.




The business are working on multiple projects to build out new Data products, this person will play a critical role in the build of these products and the efficiency of the overall Data capability.




This role has a Google suite focus (BigQuery, GA and Google Tag Manager). GTM and tagging experience is vital to succeed in this role.




Other responsibilities include:

Optimise end-to-end tracking & insight gathering
Uncover meaningful insights in UB, product performance and key commercial metrics
Work closely with the product development team to ensure innovative data products
Develop and maintain business-wide dashboards
Be the SME for Digital Analytics in the Product and Data team




Please do apply if this role seems of interest.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




We are excited to invite an enthusiastic and detail-oriented Entry-Level Data Analyst to join our team. Your contributions will play a crucial part in conducting analyses that empower our clients to make well-informed decisions. As a member of our professional and globally diverse team, you'll enjoy a supportive work environment that prioritises work-life balance, offering flexible and remote working options. Join us and take the first step in your data analytics career with a company that values your growth and well-being.




The Role

Collect data on executive and non-executive remuneration from publicly disclosed sources, collaborating with an international team
Help maintain, update, and develop new and existing tools and databases
Ensure excellent data quality and accuracy
Conduct in-depth data analysis and develop intellectual capital based on UK and global insights
Prepare reports and support ad-hoc requests for client and marketing purposes




Qualifications




The Requirements

A natural curiosity and eagerness to learn new skills and fully understand a something down to the last detail
Able to work independently and effectively, but also work collaboratively
Solid Excel and analytical skills
Previous experience in the area of board compensation is a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Why work for us?

A career at Janus Henderson is more than a job, it’s about investing in a brighter future together.

Our Mission at Janus Henderson is to help clients define and achieve superior financial outcomes through differentiated insights, disciplined investments, and world-class service. We will do this by protecting and growing our core business, amplifying our strengths, and diversifying where we have the right.

Our Values are key to driving our success, and are at the heart of everything we do:

Clients Come First - Always | Execution Supersedes Intention | Together We Win | Diversity Improves Results | Truth Builds Trust

If our mission, values, and purpose align with your own, we would love to hear from you!

Your opportunity

To join the Investment Data Strategy & Solutions Team - tasked with leading the data analysis on the components of strategic projects associated with the investment community
The Investment Data Strategy & Solutions Team is part of the Investment Management Chief Operating Officer Office (IM COO) working within Investment Management
Identify and analyse data attributes within JHI (Janus Henderson International) systems and document the impact proposed by change through projects or initiatives
Create functional requirements documents detailing current state and proposed changes and be able to clearly articulate these to impacted teams
Liaise with Technology teams, clearly communicating the development changes required for delivery and overseeing testing and sign off with business users
Generate appropriate business requirements, documents, workflows, and process maps
Analyse the usage of core and non-core data, identify opportunities to optimise or align with strategic solutions
Work with centralised Data Management teams to ensure that efforts in the Investment Management community work in synergy with those teams
Creation of repeatable data testing frameworks to ensure requirements built to your specification meet the necessary standards
Facilitate requirements gathering meetings
Leverage emerging technology and techniques to achieve your work goals in a timely manner
Liaise with stakeholders and ensure regular communications with the business, technology, and data teams
Collaborate with Data Architects to ensure all change is clearly documented by updating of conceptual and logical models and ensuring data catalogues, definitions and lineage is all aligned
Carry out other duties as assigned

What to expect when you join our firm

Hybrid working and reasonable accommodations
Generous Holiday policies
Excellent Health and Wellbeing benefits including corporate membership to ClassPass
Paid volunteer time to step away from your desk and into the community
Support to grow through professional development courses, tuition/qualification reimbursement and more
All-inclusive approach to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
Maternal/paternal leave benefits and family services
Complimentary subscription to Headspace – the mindfulness app
All employee events including networking opportunities and social activities
Lunch allowance for use within our subsidised onsite canteen

Must have skills

Experience of working on large scale data transformation projects in a Technical Business Analyst or Data Analyst role
Experience of working within a data team or dealing with processing large amounts of data
Experience does not need to be in the Asset Management industry
Experience writing & implementing business requirements, process maps, and user stories.
Good stakeholder management skills
Strong Microsoft Excel skills
Strong SQL & Python (Pandas) skills
Experience with process mapping software applications: Visio, Lucid Charts etc.
Strong technical aptitude
Analytical, structured, and logical in approach
Attention to detail and a delivery focused mind set
Organised & collaborative

Nice to have skills

Business knowledge: Asset Management, Equity, Fixed Income, OTC and Exchange Traded Derivatives, Fund Management, Security Analytics, Client Reporting, Performance Measurement and Regulatory reporting
Previous finance experience, especially middle and back-office processes
‘Big data’ analysis experience preferred
Methodologies: Agile
Machine Learning skills preferred
Systems: Charles River Development, S&P EDM (formerly CADIS), EAGLE
Scientific, Mathematical or Computer Science degree or equivalent

Supervisory responsibilities

No

Potential for growth

Mentoring
Leadership development programs
Regular training
Career development services
Continuing education courses

You will be expected to understand the regulatory obligations of the firm, and abide by the regulated entity requirements and JHI policies applicable for your role.

At Janus Henderson Investors we’re committed to an inclusive and supportive environment. We believe diversity improves results and we welcome applications from all backgrounds. Don’t worry if you don’t think you tick every box, we still want to hear from you! We understand everyone has different commitments and while we can’t accommodate every flexible working request we’re happy to be asked about work flexibility and our hybrid working environment. If you need any reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process, please get in touch and let us know at recruiter@janushenderson.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JOB TITLE –Data Analyst - Marketing

Location - London




Your New Company

With over 244 offices in 33 countries across the globe, Hays are the largest specialist recruitment agency. Hays is recognised in the recruitment sector for its industry leading training & development opportunities.




Role Objectives

The Senior Data Analyst works within the UK&I Marketing Department to develop and deliver reporting and insight analysis to all business stakeholders.







Responsibilities

Creating dashboards and reports using Excel and Power BI
Support the monitoring of marketing campaign performance across the department
Maintain and deliver monthly KPI and ROI reporting for the UK&I management board and to support the marketing planning team at regional ops meetings
Creating and maintaining documentation for processes and best practices
Improve access to data sets and bring together to automate use where possible.







Skills and Competencies

Good understanding of Marketing Principles
Work autonomously, but collaboratively, demonstrating ownership in ALL activities
Demonstrates behaviour which supports the Hays brand values: Expert; Ambitious; Inquisitive; Passionate about People
Capable of interpreting data in order to make sound and timely business decisions
MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills essential
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively under pressure and to strict deadlines




Essential

Proven ability to design visually impactful dashboards and tell a meaningful story
Experience with complex DAX queries
Using Power Query to load, transform, and curate the data
Strong SQL skills for querying and creation of views/tables, functions, and stored procedures
Logical mindset and strong attention to details
Project management skills




Desirable:

Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, formulas, shortcuts etc)
Experience with SFMC automations
Knowledge of Python
Experience with Microsoft Azure platform & service (eg DataFactory, Fabric)
Proficiency in PowerPoint
Experience with Google Analytics/Looker Studio




What you will get in return

As a global FTSE 250 business, Hays can offer you all the tools for a successful career. This is the ideal opportunity for someone with minimal experience looking to build a career in Bids and Contracts. You’ll join the team with clear objectives set out for career progression plus all the training and support you could ask for. Hays works on a flexible hybrid basis where you’ll be able to work 50% from home and 50% from our central offices. You’ll also have access to all our wide range of benefits including cycle to work, private healthcare options, buy & sell leave, shopping discounts, dedicated services for mental health support & wellbeing plus a monthly wellbeing hour to use at your own discretion plus our paid volunteering day for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow InitiativCulture built on rewarding success and the opportunity to influence your earning potential.




Best technology in the industry and a renowned training programme to support success and drive rapid career progression and ongoing development
Flexible hybrid working patterns
Opportunity to take your career globally
Incentives and rewards to recognise performance both locally, regionally and nationally
Broad range of employee wellbeing initiatives and benefits
Referral bonus scheme
Community of internal support networks.
Paid volunteering days for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow Initiative.




Life at Hays presents the opportunity for growth, varied career paths, exciting challenges and a culture of inclusion that celebrates diversity. As a committed Disability Confident employer, if you’re thinking of a new tomorrow for your career, whatever your background, let’s work together to create it!




At Hays, we share a passion for creating a culture of opportunities for our people to flourish and succeed, whatever your background. We know that diversity of perspective and an inclusive approach, which encourages those experiences and views to be heard, is great for business and therefore your career.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A prominent law firm is looking to hire a Data Analyst and can produce key analysis on various topics in particular regulatory reporting.

Responsibilities

Understand the New Business function, identifying risks involved with new clients and matters, and produce analysis and key insights to manage these risks globally.
Produce and maintain compliance and regulatory reports for internal and external clients, and regulatory bodies, while creating and updating dashboards to track metrics and visualize insights.
Build and maintain a suite of reports using Excel, SQL, and PowerBI for regular weekly and monthly reporting, working closely with the Financial Crime Team to manage new client workflow and compliance.
Enhance data integrity through ongoing manual data cleansing and collaborate with relevant teams to ensure proper data maintenance and establish Data Entry Standards.
Provide analytical support for new business initiatives, identify process efficiencies, support annual reviews of third-party software, and review new technologies, including Generative AI, to improve NB&ER processes.




Requirements

At least 1-2 years previous data analysis experience ideally within a law firm.
Expert user of Excel with experience of building and using own sophisticated spreadsheets with pivot tables and macros.
A good working knowledge of all other Microsoft packages (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook) is essential for the role.
Ideally knowledge of SQL and Power BI.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst – London
Description:
Job Position: Data Graduate

Location: Central London

Starting Salary: £26,800

Requirements: Minimum 2:1 or above in a STEM subject and experience in analysing data

Grayce is not on the UK Border Agency's Sponsor Register and is unable to sponsor work visas for international applicants. 

Change and transformation for the world’s most ambitious organisations

Grayce partners with some of the world’s most ambitious organisations to help deliver change and transformation.

With over a decade’s experience developing and deploying high-performing talent for our FTSE 100 & 250 partners, our Accelerated Development Programme has enabled thousands of talented individuals to launch successful careers.

As a change and transformation consultancy, we offer a Business and Digital development pathway. On the Digital programme you could work in Data, DevOps, Software or a Hybrid role within these disciplines.

Join us and shape your future!  

Why Grayce?

Our Analysts are actively involved in major global transformation programmes across diverse industries.

Opportunity: Over the course of 4 years, you'll embark on a journey of continuous learning, gaining industry-accredited qualifications (BCS foundations, CompTIA Cloud, Agile Practitioner), whilst getting hands-on experience working directly with prestigious FTSE100, 250, and 500 organisationsn

Mentoring: Thrive under the guidance of our experienced coaches and Technical Trainers. They’ll be your go-to, offering support, insights, sharing experiences

Community: Grayce doesn’t just talk about diversity and inclusion; we live and breathe it. Our community is built around an environment that values your unique perspective

What makes a great Grayce Analyst 

2:1 Undergraduate Degree: While having STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) background would be an advantage, we’re open to applicants from undergraduate backgrounds that have directly handled and manipulated data.

Data Tools: Previous experience with tools such as Excel, R, SQL or Python are an essential for this role. If you have utilised visualisation programmes such as Tableau or Power BI in projects before, we are also keen to hear from you.

Analytical Problem Solving: We're looking for analytical minds that can spot patterns and think creatively. Whether it's dissecting complex issues or finding fresh angles, we highly value critical thinking skills and their application.

Soft Skills: From effective communication styles to planning, organisation and a learning development mindset, Grayce is committed to building core consultancy skills. Stakeholder and time management are core skills we utilise every day and we look for examples of those through our interview process.  

Why work for us?

Competitive Salary: Starting at £26,800 with potential for significant growth in three years

Industry Recognition: We help you embark on your journey with fully funded, industry-recognised qualifications designed to maximise your experience and put you in control of your career

Mentors and Coaches: Access a network of mentors and coaches dedicated to you, your experiences and development at Grayce

Wellness Support: We are here for you 24/7 with our Employee Assistance Programme, offering confidential assistance ranging from financial and legal support to health and wellbeing

Title: Data Analyst - £600 (Outside IR35) - 6 Months
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Role: Data Analyst
Location: Hybrid (remote with 3x days in Central London)
Rate: £520 - £600 per day (Outside)
Length: 6-months (initial)

iO Associates are excited to be working with a global consulting company based in Central London. The ideal candidate will have experience in Data Analytics and exposure to finance environments. You will be supporting on a transformation project, concerning the end-customer's wholesale lending system, requiring you to provide actionable insights to guide business strategies.

The role requires you to be on-site 3x days per week in London. The contract is 6 months initially, paying up to £600 per day, Outside IR35. The client is looking for someone to start ASAP, and the interviews will be conducted in the next 2 weeks, virtually.

Skills:

Knowledge of regulatory requirements for wholesale lending (FR Y-14 is desirable)
Proven experience in data analysis and business analysis
Strong understanding of data systems and data attributes
Experience with data lineage, reconciliation, and quality assurance
Ability to identify and resolve data transformation issues
Familiarity with wholesale lending products
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Proficiency in IT skills including MS Office Suite, SQL, Collibra, Tableau, Python, and MS Power Apps

If you are coming to the end of your contract or immediately available and keen to join a global, established consultancy, don't hesitate to apply with your CV via application or email - .

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

£35,000 - £40,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

London (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate €22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Liberty’s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, Hermès, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




The perks include




25 days holiday + bank holidays.
An extra day off for moving to a new house; 2 days off for your wedding; 3 days off for charity / community days.
Private healthcare and medical cashback plan.
Perkbox.
Competitive pension plan.
Virgin gym membership.

Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (SQL / PowerBI) | £40,000 - £50,000 | 4 Days / Per Week (West London)




Here at Burns Sheehan, we have partnered up with a well-established name in the UK market for over 20 years who have just been bought out by an experienced leader in the gambling industry as they look to invest heavily within growth and explore International Markets.




As a result, they are looking for a Data Analyst to join the team and report into the Head of Analytics as one of the 1st key hires in this initial growth phase. In this role you will be responsible for taking over the curation and development of a suite of Power BI reports, which are used across all areas of the business to help drive strategy and run the day to day mechanics of the organisation.




Skills and Qualifications:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Physics, Computer Science, Mathematics or Similar...
2 + Years experience within Data Analysis
Proficient in SQL / T-SQL and PowerBI (Potentially Tableau)




With a two-decade presence in the UK, this company has a proven track record of success and customer loyalty this an amazing time to join as the companies goes from strength to strength. If you are a Data Analyst with excellent experience across both SQL and PowerBI feel free to apply and I will get back to you accordingly !!!




Data Analyst (SQL / PowerBI) | £40,000 - £50,000 | 4 Days / Per Week (West London)

Title: Business Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Business Data Analyst: Power BI, Alteryx, Automation, Actuarial
Business Data Analyst required for a dynamic Specialist Insurer, who are committed to leveraging data & analytics to drive their underwriting function. This is a multi-faceted role where you will support the actuarial reserving & finance team, contributing to improving data analysis & data quality capabilities.

Coming from the London Markets, you will have a deep understanding of business processes coupled with strong Data Analytical skills. You will have experience supporting large datasets and excellent knowledge of Alteryx & Power BI for reporting & automation tasks.

This is an ideal role for a business focused Data Analyst who is motivated by a data-first environment.


Responsibilities:

Collaborate with actuarial & finance function to support business needs & translate into data solutions
Utilize Alteryx & Power BI for reporting & automation tasks
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across data cleansing, collection and analysis
Identifying gaps and opportunities in Data findings, correcting data errors and improving data quality processes
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.


Requirements:

London Markets Insurance experience is required
Demonstrated experience working with Power BI and Alteryx
Experience supporting large amounts of data
Understanding of Data Quality procedures & processes
Ability to work with cross-functional departments i.e. finance, actuarial, underwriting etc


Business Data Analyst: Power BI, Alteryx, Automation, Actuarial

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Insight Global is seeking a Data Analyst, for a 6 month extended contract (Inside IR35), for a leading company in the investment banking industry, based in London or Birmingham.




You will be expected to be onsite 5 times weekly.




The candidate will be part of a global team focused on Incident and change management. The chosen candidate will be involved in generating monthly incident and change management reports for the firm and evolving them to become more automated.




Targeting the following skillsets:

· Experience Data Analyst in an enterprise organization.

· Extensive experience creating reports for C-Level executives and stakeholders.

· Highly proficient in Excel (incl. advanced formulas macros) and PowerPoint

· Thorough experience with data manipulation, interpretation, analyzing trends/themes and providing possible resolutions.

· Able to work in high pressure tight deliverable situations to perform statistical analysis for use by senior leadership and audit teams
