Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Purpose

At Travelex, data is at the heart of our relationship with our customers. We analyse data in order to understand what our customers prefer and how our products perform. Our work is fast-paced although our team remains collaborative and flexible even when delivering fast.

Your role as data analyst will be to run a wide range of queries on our datasets, interpret the results, and communicate your findings to colleagues and stakeholders. You will be working with product owners, subject matter experts, managers and engineers across the company to develop deep insight on our customers and products.

You will have an end-to-end responsibility for your deliverables: from leading the work to agree the right approach, through developing, running and continuously refining your queries, all the way to presenting your results and recommending what the business should do about them. You will have significant impact on the way our business evolves, and a high level of freedom to do things in your own way.

Responsibilities

Here are key things you’ll do as a data analyst in our team. The list isn’t complete: as a competent analyst, you’ll bring to Travelex your own ideas of what else is needed to become a world-class data-driven business.


Work with colleagues to understand their analytical needs and convert these into robust analytical tasks
Explore data in a range of business domains, such as: retail customer behaviour; online customer behaviour; payment cards; product performance; colleague performance; HR; finance, cost and pricing
Analyse data to understand trends, gaps and anomalies
Build time series, models and forecasts
Compare the performance of products, campaigns and sales across the different geographies where Travelex operates
Help automate analytical tasks so that powerful analytics can come with little effort
Present your findings in a simple, compelling and inspiring way
Develop visualisations and infographics that will shed light on complex business questions
Derive metrics from data and build the processes to monitor these metrics over time
Have particular responsibility for data quality: defining it, monitoring it and improving it


Key Requirements

This vacancy is for someone who greatly enjoys problem-solving, simplifying complex data into simple insight, and continuous learning. Below are key requirements from our data analyst, but you don’t need to tick every box: success in our team comes in many forms!


Competent in analysing data using SQL and Python
Familiar with AWS, including databases, data services and analytics capabilities
Experienced with SageMaker
Capable of creating engaging visualisations and infographics
A strong storyteller, who can turn a big pile of numbers into an interesting narrative
Self-starter and independent, able to turn loosely-defined requirements into concrete deliverables by asking questions, taking initiative and recommending a way forward
A good team player, who enjoys brainstorming and engaging, and is able to resolve differences of opinion in a constructive way
Understands the foundations of information security and data protection
Able to learn new tools, languages and methods quickly
Have the curiosity to understand the business, its requirements and culture
Knowledge of visualisation tools (e.g. Amazon QuickSight) and data modelling techniques isn’t essential but would be an advantage
Familiarity with DBT would be an advantage
Experience of building machine learning models, and familiarity with the common ML libraries in Python, would be an advantage
Your own unique style or way of working, which will make our team diverse and original


Why Travelex?

To remain the world’s leading Foreign Exchange specialist, we focus on making our customers’ lives hassle-free while they travel.

We are customer-centric and innovative. Our digital and data products are part of our investment in the future of Foreign Exchange, cross-border e-commerce and international payments.

We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Rapp

We stand up for individuality. We actively foster an inclusive workplace where diversity and individual difference are valued and leveraged to achieve the agency’s vision. And most importantly we value every individual’s wellbeing.

As a diversity champion, equal opportunities and disability confident employer and an ardent advocate of flexible working we understand that everyone has unique requirements and needs.

We are a global creative agency, but the individual really is at the heart of everything we do. We use data to find out what makes them tick. We use technology to talk to them one-to-one – but to one million at a time. And we use creativity to encourage them to engage, click, buy and bond, again and again.

Each brand is unique and has its own individual challenges. We pride ourselves in rising to each and every one of them, for brands such as KFC, Mercedes Benz, IKEA, Paypal and Virgin Media 02.

Us

In order to foster collaboration and relationships, our hybrid model requires three office days per week. As equal opportunities proponents, we are open to discuss any hybrid working related needs during the initial screening.

Learning and Development is important. We all know that. Its why we have a dedicated Learning and Development team and offer regular career conversations and bespoke L&D programmes so that you can leave us with more than when you started.

We recognise that the work of diversity, equity and inclusion calls on all of us. That’s why we set up The Neighbourhood. A collective of people, at different stages of the DE&I journey, whether impacted or allies, dedicated to helping our colleagues take ownership and effect change across 4 key pillars; Anti-racism, Disability, Gender & LGBTQ+ and Parents & Carers.

The Health and Wellbeing of our people matters immensely. We offer Coaching opportunities for all through our partnerships with Sanctus (mental health partner who provides online coaching; you can talk about anything, personal or professional) and Sayge (1:1 professional development coaching program). We have 40 trained Mental Health First Aiders across the agency and have Babylon Health (Private GP service) for all.

You’re better at work when you feel better in yourself. So, in addition to your annual holiday, you can take a “Me” day and an “Us” day, every year. Your “Me” day is for you to invest in yourself – go after a life goal, meditate, learn to paint, bake cakes or just have a duvet day watching Netflix!

Your “Us” day is all about giving back and helping others – volunteer, pick litter at a local park, hang out with the elderly or raise money for a local charity.

We’re progressive and always open to new initiatives, for example we’ve recently partnered with Fertifa (Leading Fertility and Reproductive Health benefit providers). Because we know the journey to becoming a family isn’t always easy (that includes men too), and we support our people through that journey whether you are new parent, experiencing the menopause, or anything else in between.

Whatever stage of life you are at, we make sure you have the tools you need to have a healthy work life balance.

US MARKETING SCIENCES

The Marketing Sciences team at RAPP is a driving force behind the agency's success, harnessing the power of data and technology. We are superconnectors, bridging the gap between creativity, data and tech to unlock limitless possibilities and disruption.

Our mission is to provide deep insights and a true robust understanding of our clients' businesses and marketing challenges. Our expertise is to empower our agency and the client to make data-driven decisions that directly impact performance and drive measurable results.

From identifying the untapped value of client data to expanding its potential through data capture, rigorous analysis, and statistical techniques, we leave no stone unturned. We are split into 4 disciplines in Marketing Sciences; Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Enablement and Data Visualisation to enable us to deliver against any client data driven challenge.

Together, we will revolutionize the way data is utilised, ensuring that every action we take contributes to the success of our clients and propels the agency forward. Welcome to a future where data and technology and your ideas push the boundaries of what's possible.

Your Role

In the Data Analytics team you will ensure both the voice of the customer and CFO are represented in the room with hard evidence. As well as supporting exceptional customer experiences using data, you will help ensure every action we take is directly improving performance against your clients objectives.

As an Analyst, you will work under supervision to deliver projects within set deadlines, utilising your strong hands on analytical capabilities. Your strengths in Python and SQL will ensure you can efficiently deliver robust analytics with guidance from your team.

Your experience with web and social analytics tools (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr) and data visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc) will enable you to uncover key insights across channels and create self-service dashboards.

You will be comfortable working as part of a team with supervision from seniors, whilst being able to execute analysis independently.

Whilst no two days will look the same, you’ll be sharing findings back to more senior members of the team to shape for articulation to clients.

Under the guidance of senior members of the team you support answering strategic questions using data and forge an understanding of how to deliver personalisation at scale.

In Data Analytics you won’t be expected to build advanced segmentations and data science models, but you will develop an understanding of the art of the possible with data science, the necessary data required to fuel models and an ability to spot where a business challenge would be best supported through automation or leveraging the latest modelling techniques.

You will have a developing interest with the omni-channel landscape and be able to develop a strong understanding of how to capture and utilise data across channels, from creating tagging and taxonomy to measurement with web analytics tools.

Once you join the team, you will be onboarded to our product suite and playbooks and be capable of articulating and following these best-in-class approaches.

The ideal candidate is ready to jump in. Find problems. Fix them. Build relationships. Stay up-to-date with the latest innovations. Do whatever it takes to go above and beyond. And stand up for individuality.

Your Responsibilities

Management


You will be mentored to understand how to become a manager
You will follow the direction of your line manager and manage upwards when needed


Client


Understanding clients’ objectives, their business and KPIs and step change their businesses through the power of data
Deliver and understand the role of the work briefed to you
Challenge the briefs and ambition of the work
Build relationships with analysts client side
Support the creation of best-in-class, statistically significant, measurement and reporting
Collaborate in a results-driven, test, learn and optimisation culture for the client
Communicate analytical outputs
Ensure deliverables are completed on time and learn to deliver presentation quality
Follow robust, scalable and efficient processes for delivery

New Business / PR


Be aware of our new business pitches and work we are doing
Participate in thought pieces / case studies / award entries showing off your work to the industry


Network


Understand our network and other players within it


Evolution


Focus on your constant evolution - Show a desire to learn and develop core analytical skills
Understand your strengths and weaknesses and train accordingly


Your Skills And Experience


Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative subject (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics) or Social Sciences, with heavy emphasis on quantitative methods; Master’s degree or PHD is a plus. Degree will not be required with appropriate work experience.
1 – 2 years of relevant experience in marketing analytics, customer experience insights, performance optimization, ideally in a marketing agency or management consulting practice.
You will be expected to have an understanding and with guidance utilise our core technical skills:
Core analytical languages and software (Excel, SQL, Python, Alteryx)
Statistics
Data Visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc)
Web and Social Analytics (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr)
Value engineering / Business casing
Performance Measurement and Measurement Frameworks
Data Protection / GDPR
Customer journey analysis and planning
Brief planning and writing
Progressive data capture
Segmentation and Modelling
Martech design and ecosystem tracking (tagging and taxonomy)
Developing knowledge of experimental / multivariate test design techniques.
Growing knowledge of 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data
Confident, conscientious, self-starter, a good work ethic, and capable of building good working relationships with clients as well as other team members.
Naturally curious, imaginative and have a practical approach to problem solving.
Experience jumping in, finding problems across data and process, and fixing them.
Ability to work independently as well with a team in an agile and fast environment.
Ability to develop, learn, follow and adapt repeatable processes or products to drive efficiency and consistency of delivery.


Recruitment process

We’re not a 9 stage interview process agency. We like to keep recruitment swift, lean and individual and find that 2 or 3 stages gives all parties the opportunity to get to know each other. Plus we have a team on hand to answer questions throughout the process.

We are RAPP. And we can’t wait to meet you
Show more
HTML:
About Rapp

We stand up for individuality. We actively foster an inclusive workplace where diversity and individual difference are valued and leveraged to achieve the agency’s vision. And most importantly we value every individual’s wellbeing.

As a diversity champion, equal opportunities and disability confident employer and an ardent advocate of flexible working we understand that everyone has unique requirements and needs.

We are a global creative agency, but the individual really is at the heart of everything we do. We use data to find out what makes them tick. We use technology to talk to them one-to-one – but to one million at a time. And we use creativity to encourage them to engage, click, buy and bond, again and again.

Each brand is unique and has its own individual challenges. We pride ourselves in rising to each and every one of them, for brands such as KFC, Mercedes Benz, IKEA, Paypal and Virgin Media 02.

Us

In order to foster collaboration and relationships, our hybrid model requires three office days per week. As equal opportunities proponents, we are open to discuss any hybrid working related needs during the initial screening.

Learning and Development is important. We all know that. Its why we have a dedicated Learning and Development team and offer regular career conversations and bespoke L&D programmes so that you can leave us with more than when you started.

We recognise that the work of diversity, equity and inclusion calls on all of us. That’s why we set up The Neighbourhood. A collective of people, at different stages of the DE&I journey, whether impacted or allies, dedicated to helping our colleagues take ownership and effect change across 4 key pillars; Anti-racism, Disability, Gender & LGBTQ+ and Parents & Carers.

The Health and Wellbeing of our people matters immensely. We offer Coaching opportunities for all through our partnerships with Sanctus (mental health partner who provides online coaching; you can talk about anything, personal or professional) and Sayge (1:1 professional development coaching program). We have 40 trained Mental Health First Aiders across the agency and have Babylon Health (Private GP service) for all.

You’re better at work when you feel better in yourself. So, in addition to your annual holiday, you can take a “Me” day and an “Us” day, every year. Your “Me” day is for you to invest in yourself – go after a life goal, meditate, learn to paint, bake cakes or just have a duvet day watching Netflix!

Your “Us” day is all about giving back and helping others – volunteer, pick litter at a local park, hang out with the elderly or raise money for a local charity.

We’re progressive and always open to new initiatives, for example we’ve recently partnered with Fertifa (Leading Fertility and Reproductive Health benefit providers). Because we know the journey to becoming a family isn’t always easy (that includes men too), and we support our people through that journey whether you are new parent, experiencing the menopause, or anything else in between.

Whatever stage of life you are at, we make sure you have the tools you need to have a healthy work life balance.

US MARKETING SCIENCES

The Marketing Sciences team at RAPP is a driving force behind the agency's success, harnessing the power of data and technology. We are superconnectors, bridging the gap between creativity, data and tech to unlock limitless possibilities and disruption.

Our mission is to provide deep insights and a true robust understanding of our clients' businesses and marketing challenges. Our expertise is to empower our agency and the client to make data-driven decisions that directly impact performance and drive measurable results.

From identifying the untapped value of client data to expanding its potential through data capture, rigorous analysis, and statistical techniques, we leave no stone unturned. We are split into 4 disciplines in Marketing Sciences; Data Science, Data Analytics, Data Enablement and Data Visualisation to enable us to deliver against any client data driven challenge.

Together, we will revolutionize the way data is utilised, ensuring that every action we take contributes to the success of our clients and propels the agency forward. Welcome to a future where data and technology and your ideas push the boundaries of what's possible.

Your Role

In the Data Analytics team you will ensure both the voice of the customer and CFO are represented in the room with hard evidence. As well as supporting exceptional customer experiences using data, you will help ensure every action we take is directly improving performance against your clients objectives.

As an Analyst, you will work under supervision to deliver projects within set deadlines, utilising your strong hands on analytical capabilities. Your strengths in Python and SQL will ensure you can efficiently deliver robust analytics with guidance from your team.

Your experience with web and social analytics tools (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr) and data visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc) will enable you to uncover key insights across channels and create self-service dashboards.

You will be comfortable working as part of a team with supervision from seniors, whilst being able to execute analysis independently.

Whilst no two days will look the same, you’ll be sharing findings back to more senior members of the team to shape for articulation to clients.

Under the guidance of senior members of the team you support answering strategic questions using data and forge an understanding of how to deliver personalisation at scale.

In Data Analytics you won’t be expected to build advanced segmentations and data science models, but you will develop an understanding of the art of the possible with data science, the necessary data required to fuel models and an ability to spot where a business challenge would be best supported through automation or leveraging the latest modelling techniques.

You will have a developing interest with the omni-channel landscape and be able to develop a strong understanding of how to capture and utilise data across channels, from creating tagging and taxonomy to measurement with web analytics tools.

Once you join the team, you will be onboarded to our product suite and playbooks and be capable of articulating and following these best-in-class approaches.

The ideal candidate is ready to jump in. Find problems. Fix them. Build relationships. Stay up-to-date with the latest innovations. Do whatever it takes to go above and beyond. And stand up for individuality.

Your Responsibilities

Management

  • You will be mentored to understand how to become a manager
  • You will follow the direction of your line manager and manage upwards when needed

Client

  • Understanding clients’ objectives, their business and KPIs and step change their businesses through the power of data
    • Deliver and understand the role of the work briefed to you
    • Challenge the briefs and ambition of the work
    • Build relationships with analysts client side
    • Support the creation of best-in-class, statistically significant, measurement and reporting
    • Collaborate in a results-driven, test, learn and optimisation culture for the client
    • Communicate analytical outputs
    • Ensure deliverables are completed on time and learn to deliver presentation quality
    • Follow robust, scalable and efficient processes for delivery
New Business / PR

  • Be aware of our new business pitches and work we are doing
  • Participate in thought pieces / case studies / award entries showing off your work to the industry

Network

  • Understand our network and other players within it

Evolution

  • Focus on your constant evolution - Show a desire to learn and develop core analytical skills
  • Understand your strengths and weaknesses and train accordingly

Your Skills And Experience

  • Bachelor’s Degree in a quantitative subject (Statistics, Mathematics, Economics) or Social Sciences, with heavy emphasis on quantitative methods; Master’s degree or PHD is a plus. Degree will not be required with appropriate work experience.
  • 1 – 2 years of relevant experience in marketing analytics, customer experience insights, performance optimization, ideally in a marketing agency or management consulting practice.
  • You will be expected to have an understanding and with guidance utilise our core technical skills:
    • Core analytical languages and software (Excel, SQL, Python, Alteryx)
    • Statistics
    • Data Visualisation tools (Power BI / Tableau / Looker / etc)
    • Web and Social Analytics (GA / Adobe / Brandwatch / Sprinklr)
    • Value engineering / Business casing
    • Performance Measurement and Measurement Frameworks
    • Data Protection / GDPR
    • Customer journey analysis and planning
    • Brief planning and writing
    • Progressive data capture
    • Segmentation and Modelling
    • Martech design and ecosystem tracking (tagging and taxonomy)
    • Developing knowledge of experimental / multivariate test design techniques.
    • Growing knowledge of 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data
    • Confident, conscientious, self-starter, a good work ethic, and capable of building good working relationships with clients as well as other team members.
    • Naturally curious, imaginative and have a practical approach to problem solving.
    • Experience jumping in, finding problems across data and process, and fixing them.
    • Ability to work independently as well with a team in an agile and fast environment.
    • Ability to develop, learn, follow and adapt repeatable processes or products to drive efficiency and consistency of delivery.

    Recruitment process

    We’re not a 9 stage interview process agency. We like to keep recruitment swift, lean and individual and find that 2 or 3 stages gives all parties the opportunity to get to know each other. Plus we have a team on hand to answer questions throughout the process.

    We are RAPP. And we can’t wait to meet you

Title: Data Analyst (SQL/EXCEL) GLOBAL SAAS!
Place: Kingston Upon Thames, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Are you a driven and recent IT Graduate with a strong passion for Data and Analytics? Do you have 1+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst? Are you looking for a real challenge? This company has been trading for 20 years!. Do you love data?

You will be joining a very well-funded SAAS software company who has recently received a HUGE CASH INJECTION! So it's now time to grow the Data team. APPLY NOW!!!

This is an amazing chance to join a progressive company with a long-term career on offer to move into Data Analysts, Data Engineering and to work for a GLOBAL SAAS Company who works with the S&P 500 companies to make a big impact!.

The Data Analyst must have at least 1+ years' experience. This is a great role for a second jobber!

Overall, the purpose of this role will be to maintain and ensure the quality of the data, ensuring timeliness of data availability.

This is a hand-on and fast paced role that requires pragmaticism and problem solving skills.

Key Responsibilities


Downloading and adding data into a global database
Data validation and correction using in-house applications, Excel and SQL Server Management Studio
Investigation of new patent data sources
Dealing with helpdesk support queries
Working with the development team regarding data extraction and application troubleshooting
Specification writing of new in-house applications
User Acceptance Testing of new in-house applications
Ensuring data quality with emphasis on attention to detail
Ensuring all data feeds are completed on time
Data source ownership and process reviews in order to improve speed, accuracy and automation opportunities


Person Spec


Good communication, detail orientated, methodical and numerate
Experience of querying databases using SQL Server
Excellent computer skills including Word and Excel
Excellent oral and written communication skills


Interviews will be arranged ASAP.

2 Stage process and quick turnaround.

Hybrid working 2 days in the office in South West London (excellent transport links including people who live close to the overground, district line, Piccadilly line and national rail) and 3 days from home. More flex on offer for the right person but this is a hybrid working role.

Excellent Benefits on offer

Pension

Bonus

25 days holidays +8 Bank Holidays

Robert Half Ltd acts as an employment business for temporary positions and an employment agency for permanent positions. Robert Half is committed to equal opportunity and diversity. Suitable candidates with equivalent qualifications and more or less experience can apply. Rates of pay and salary ranges are dependent upon your experience, qualifications and training. If you wish to apply, please read our Privacy Notice describing how we may process, disclose and store your personal data: roberthalf.com/gb/en/privacy-notice

Security alert: scammers are currently targeting jobseekers. Robert Half do not ask candidates for a fee or request candidates to send applications through instant messaging services such as WhatsApp or Telegram. Learn how to protect yourself by visiting our website: roberthalf.com/gb/en/how-spot-recruitment-scams-and-protect-yourself

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Full time (35hr per week), permanent

Location: London / Hybrid




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing data team, this is more than a standard data role. This is an opportunity to work collaboratively.




The Data Team is responsible for collecting all the primary and secondary data required for Lumina’s products and making it accessible internally and to clients. The Data Analyst role sits within the Data Management Team, whose objective is to provide and enhance data in the right format for every type of data user. This position joins the data team reporting to the Head of Data.




As the Data Analyst your main objective is to restructure raw data from our data collection into a format that fits our databases and analyse to identify key trends, patterns and insights that inform business decisions.




What you’ll be doing:




Restructuring and maintaining data into a database-friendly multi-table format for all our product trackers and bespoke research.
Implementing systems to help the optimisation of data efficiency and data quality.
Acquiring data from primary or secondary data sources to enrich our internal data.
Assisting in the identification, design, development, and maintenance of new and existing data tools and applications.
Troubleshooting our databases and BI tools to ensure minimal client disruption.
The setting up and maintenance of automated data processes.
Tracking KPIs of our systems and processes
Analysing large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions.




What you’ll need:




Strong numeracy skills.
Experience with Python and a passion for learning new languages and technologies.
Strong understanding of relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server).
Advanced Excel data handling and modelling.
Analytical and problem-solving skills to spot trends, errors and highlight/rectify.
Understand the process of acquiring, cleansing, and transforming data.
Be very organised and structured.
Be able to meet deadlines and communicate progress.
Be flexible to adapt if plans change.
Be a self-starter and motivator with the ability to work in an autonomous fast paced environment.
Experience using GitHub, BitBucket, or another SCM platform.




It would be great if you also have:




Prior commercial experience, working with consumer data in a data analytics role.
Web scraping and the use of automation tools like Selenium.




Company Benefits Include:




25 days annual leave in addition to bank holidays- increasing by one additional day after 6 years, up to a maximum of 30 days.
An additional day of leave for you to take on a cultural celebration day or on your birthday if you like. A day for you! At William Reed, we call this our “MeDay”.
A volunteer day to take for supporting a chosen charity and giving back to the community.
Opportunity for hybrid working
Contributory Pension
Life Assurance Scheme
Group Income Protection
Enhanced family-friendly leave pay entitlements
Wellbeing benefits, including: A health care cash plan, Employee assistance programme and a 12-month wellness calendar for company-wide health, wellbeing, diversity & inclusion awareness dates.
Cycle to Work Scheme
Electric Car Scheme




Why work for us:




We provide a supportive work environment and are committed to maintaining a healthy work/life balance for all of our employees. Working for William Reed means that you will be joining a stable organisation that is committed to developing its employees and brands.




We warmly welcome and encourage applications from talented individuals of all backgrounds and characteristics.




If you need any support in accessing this opportunity, please do not hesitate to discuss this with us.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our Mission

We're not your average benefits platform; we're the unordinary force that uplifts people's lives. Our technology is the link that connects the entire benefits ecosystem, creating better outcomes for employers, employees, brokers, and providers.

Our mission is clear: we're here to create a world where everything operates at its very best, ensuring that every employee receives the support they need to live life to the fullest, both at work and beyond.

Your Mission

As a Data Analyst at Ben, you will be joining at a crucial time in the evolution of our product-engineering organisation as we build out the foundational pillars of our data function.

This is an incredible opportunity to join a business where we are looking to build out our analytical function from scratch. You will be owning a number of tools and work closely with the product and business teams to define KPIs, perform exploratory analysis and set up reporting that will drive the business towards being truly data-driven.

Things you will be working on…


Be the first port of call for the business in triaging data issues, determining the root cause and resolving where appropriate
Work collaboratively with our Marketplace, Product, Support, Operations, Customer Success and other engineering teams to resolve issues in a timely fashion
Maintain our service levels with customers by ensuring queries are investigated and resolved within SLA timeframes
Support the business in making data driven decisions and carrying out repeatable analysis
Develop reporting and dashboards to enable the business to track trends and perform business-critical analysis at scale
Establish processes to root cause and solve open-ended problems
Be an expert on the product - understand and communicate the underlying concepts within the product, be the point of contact when supporting other business functions in their understanding of the products dataflows


You’ll love this role if you have:


SQL expertise: you can debug complex queries to optimise for both quality and performance
The ability to identify the root cause of data issues and working with engineering teams to resolve them in a timely manner
Experience with a BI/visualisation tools such as Looker, Metabase, Lightdash. You know how to design and build dashboards to enable repeatable analysis
An analytical mindset: you know how to turn raw data into actionable insights. You have experience defining KPIs and building the reporting to measure them
Familiarity with dbt is a nice to have


and you...


are a self-starter who thrives on autonomy, enjoys a rapid pace and wants to make a difference
have a continuous improvement mindset. You appreciate that there are always ways to do things better and ensure your team does too
have a preference to action-oriented behaviour with just enough analysis, as compared to too much time spent doing analysis with no action
have the ability to make decisions balancing different factors such as business requirements, technical integrity, overall priorities etc.
appreciate the opportunities and challenges of a distributed work environment
are solution-focused with a pragmatic approach to problem-solving


Diversity and Culture at Ben

We are organically growing a brilliantly diverse, inclusive and respectful bunch of people we are extremely proud of. This should go without saying but all applications are very much welcome. If you need any adjustments to support you with your application, just let us know by emailing jobs@thanksben.com.

Our BENefits

(... It's all in the name! 😉)

💰 Competitive base salary and equity, so you own what you build

💳 £100 monthly personal Ben Balance: for whatever works for you, whether that's Netflix, Spotify, or a really expensive cup of coffee! This allowance will increase by £50 for each year of service until you reach £250

🔋 £1000 annual Learning & Personal Development Ben Balance: plus 3 days paid study leave a year to support you with your professional development

👩🏽‍💻 £500 work from home set up allowance, which you can put towards your home office

🍔 Weekly lunch provided in office so you can spend quality time with the team over some tasty food!

🏖 28 days of holidays a year (plus bank holidays, which you have the option of swapping for days of celebration that are significant to you)

🌴 ...and an option to buy or sell 5 days per year. Also, your holiday entitlement will increase to 30 days at your 3rd year of service!

🍼 Enhanced parental leave and workplace nursery scheme to support with the cost of childcare in a nursery setting

🧠 Comprehensive and tailored mental health support through a leading provider

💪 Access to a Gympass membership!

❤️ Comprehensive Private Medical Insurance

🍿 Team activities: we have quarterly team social budgets to support spending time together and we frequently organise company wide events

📅 Hybrid Working - we work 3 days in the office, 2 days remotely
Show more

🍼 Enhanced parental leave and workplace nursery scheme to support with the cost of childcare in a nursery setting

🧠 Comprehensive and tailored mental health support through a leading provider

💪 Access to a Gympass membership!

❤️ Comprehensive Private Medical Insurance

🍿 Team activities: we have quarterly team social budgets to support spending time together and we frequently organise company wide events

📅 Hybrid Working - we work 3 days in the office, 2 days remotely

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're hiring the very best data analysts to join our agile in-house team. You will be working on the fastest growing direct to consumer (e-commerce) brands and will have access to unlimited performance bonus.




What You'll Be Doing




Launch and optimize social, native and search advertising campaigns
Improve Conversion Rate across multiple funnels - multivariant and A/B testing
Design new funnels and analyse granular data using proprietary data warehouse
Manage unlimited budget while staying profitable. Compensation is directly correlated to your personal campaign performance and paid monthly
Optional managerial roles available




What You'll Need




Results-driven and numbers-oriented personality
High attention to detail
Flexibility and adaptability
Commitment to innovations




A little about us




We're passionate about building life changing consumer products and delivering them with astonishing service. We are also one of the UK's fastest growing direct to consumer companies.




The Benefits




Salary above market
All the latest tech you need
Pension plan

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join a scale-up company with a fantastic culture.
Join a growing business who have multiple positions across various teams.
Expand your knowledge and skillset while working with DBT and Looker.




This role enables an experienced data analyst to further their career in a fast paced, exciting environment which is constantly growing. They’ll enable you to work with DBT, Looker, SQL and Snowflake while working on various projects and specialising in a sector of the business.




What you’ll be doing

Sitting within this modern data environment, in a growing team and industry, you’ll be helping customers who struggle to get fair car insurance; people who have immigrated to the UK and struggle to drive here for the first time; and then you’ll be helping the company to retain those customers.




They’re hiring across three different teams and are considering candidates for different areas of the business; whether it be looking at customer and insurance fraud; customer segmentation and acquisitions; or insurance claims analysis; they’re hoping to grow in different areas.




This company have rapidly grown since their founding, having become profitable in the last few years and going from ‘start-up’ to ‘scale-up’, there is now no stopping them. Data has been important to them from the get-go, meaning they see the value of this – and their data teams – resulting in a modern data environment.




Please note there is a requirement of two days a week in the office in London and therefore we require someone within a commutable distance to commit to this.

What experience you’ll need to apply

Several years’ experience working as a Data Analyst
Experience within a start up is a must – this role requires someone who has experience working in a start up or scale up environment to be considered for this role
Strong SQL experience
Bonus for DBT and/or Looker experience
Bonus for any experience working in claims, acquisitions or fraud
Previous experience managing and building relationships with stakeholders
Ideally working in an agile environment




What you’ll get in return for your experience

They’re offering a salary of up to £84,000 for the right person, plus bonus and excellent benefits! They foster training, support and a collaborative environment and have a strong culture.




What next

Please get in touch with Tegan with an updated CV today. Don’t hesitate to call/email with any questions.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Engineering

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: London, UK

Reporting To: Jubin Sadeghi

Compensation: £30,000 - £50,000 / year

Description

White Swan Data is a small but rapidly growing team of mathematicians, data scientists and software engineers who are constantly striving to refine world class betting models while also researching and deploying new ones. Our work bridges three domains, each challenging in its own right - betting and gambling, quantitative research and software development.

We are seeking a talented Data Analyst, well-versed in the R programming language, who can pull actionable insights out of large data sets. As a member of the team, you will be working on a variety of different projects and collaborating with the team to ensure we deliver to our clients needs.

We will consider graduate applicants if we feel your degree has equipped you with the necessary skills to further develop in this role.

Key Responsibilities


Dive into diverse datasets to extract meaningful patterns, trends, and insights.
Cleanse and process data to ensure accuracy and reliability in analysis.
Utilise statistical methods to interpret and validate findings, contributing to data-driven decision-making.
Develop comprehensive reports to communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Stay updated on the latest industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analytics.
Implement and maintain data quality assurance processes to ensure the reliability of analytical outputs.


Requirements

Must Have -


Proficiency in the R programming language, ideally ggplot2, tidyverse and data.table.
Advanced spreadsheeting skills, ideally google-sheets and Excel.
A passion for data analytics and a desire to translate complex data into actionable insights.
A Bachelor's degree in a data-oriented subject (statistics, econometrics, economics etc) and/or several years of highly relevant experience in data analysis using the above software.


Desirable -


Previous experience using the SQL/Sequel programming language.
Experience in creating compelling visualisations using tools like Tableau, PowerBI, or Grafana software.
Experience of data manipulation, management and reporting.
Adept at solving analytical problems with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to convey technical findings to non-technical audiences.
Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively within a team.
A passion and understanding of sports and sports betting markets/odds.


Benefits


Competitive salary depending on experience.
Annual discretionary performance bonus.
5 days holiday per annum, plus UK bank holidays.
Private health & dental insurance.
Pension plan.
Complimentary gym membership
Regular team events/socials.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - £45,000 - £55,000 Bens - Surbiton
Description:
Role: Data AnalystLocation: Surbiton - HybridSalary: £45,000 to £55,000 + Benefits

Skills

An organisation based in Surbiton are looking transform their Data Division and currently have a fantastic opportunity for a Data Analyst. The Data Analyst will be comfortable working independently and have the opportunity to present and contribute new ideas to all departments of the business.Essential Skills for the Data Analyst:


Comfortable writing SQL queries and linking them to Reporting systems
Experience making data visualisation dashboards with ideally Power BI however open to experience with Tableau, SSRS etc.
Practical experience with DAX
Great communication skills
Ability to interact with both technical and non-technical users
Be able to present clear and logical data across multiple departments


This company are looking for an Data Analyst who has a strong base of knowledge and is looking to join a supportive team however prepared to work independently. They will work with a variety of Data types and have the chance to get involved with project work such as managing and developing an Azure Data Lake and working with Data Warehouses. There are various ways for the Data Analyst to build on their current skill set with plenty of opportunities for progression into Senior Data positions.

Desirable Skills For TheData Analyst


Experience working with Data in Azure
Prior experience of working with Data Warehouses
Experience in Mining Extracting and Manipulating data
Understanding of the Data Lifecyle (Ingestion, Transformation and Consumption)
Experience with Data Formats i.e. Python
Any related Qualifications


If you are interested in this great opportunity to join organisation who place employee satisfaction and development over profit, then please apply for this SQLData Analyst with a copy of your latest CV and we will be in touch.

Description:
Mid-sized Asset Manager are looking to bring on an Application Support specialist, to focus on supporting their newly implemented Data Platform.

Relevant industry experience - Asset Management / Insurance
SQL experience

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Immediate Start

Central London (4 days a week)

£45,000 - £50,000




The Company

A leading property investment and development firm specialising in the Student Accommodation and Build to Rent sectors. The focus is on investing, developing, and managing purpose-built assets to create sustainable and high-quality living environments.




The Role and Responsibilities

We are looking for a dynamic Data Analyst to join immediately. The successful candidate will develop data-driven insights for our investment team, focusing on sustainability, decarbonisation, and end-user behaviour.




Key Responsibilities:

Gather requirements from stakeholders across various teams.
Develop data for the investment team around sustainability, decarbonisation and end-user behaviour.
Design and build metrics, followed by creating data visualizations in Power BI or Tableau to support product launches.
Utilise a tech stack of BigQuery, Tableau, Power BI and SQL.







Your Experience

To qualify for this role, you will require the following:

Strong mathematical or statistical background.
Experience in either Tableau or Power BI.
Industry experience in investment or the real estate sector.
A proactive individual with a keen interest in the property investment and real estate industry, eager to learn and grow within the role.




How to Apply

Please send your CV via the Apply link on this website or send it to carlotashepherd@harnham.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DATA ANALYST

CENTRAL LONDON - HYBRID

£40,000 - £50,000

THE COMPANY

International provider of business information training and consultancy within the marketing and legal space.

THE ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

As a Data Analyst, your day-to-day will involve:

Data Mining - extract insights, organize information effectively, and apply statistical analysis to identify actionable trends in market and law firm performance.
Predictive Data Models - Develop predictive data models and collaborate with teams to address key business questions using data.
Dashboarding in Power BI - maintain and develop reports in Power BI for internal stakeholder use, which will be used to provide actionable insights to customers.
Data Pipelining - work with the central data team to ensure data is smoothly and effectively being collected, stored and processed throughout.

YOUR EXPERIENCE

To be successful in this Data Analyst role, you will require:

Strong dashboarding experience in Power BI, with an understanding of DAX measures and data modelling.
A strong understanding of data mining, ETL pipelines and processes.
Experience working as a sole contributor is preferred.

THE BENEFITS

A salary of up to £50,000 in your first year.
Flexible working.
Other benefits.

HOW TO APPLY

If interested in this role, please submit your CV via the Apply link on this page.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This is a fantastic opportunity to join a leading alcohol brand team of a leading global media agency with a large and innovative range of research solutions, to get close to client’s business and communication strategy, to work at a regional and global level with multiple markets, to gain exposure to new data analytics techniques and to build experience across different industries.

As a Data Analyst that owns a market leading portfolio, and you’ll support the team to maintain and build dashboards and various reporting tools. You will support the delivery of reporting solutions and any data analytics project paying particular attention to data governance and to the clients’ requirements.

Our team makes a very significant contribution to our agency’s income through work delivered to our clients, and we support nearly every new business pitch. We also develop simple but original ways to help our account teams interrogate performance and industry data sets to quickly answer key client questions – enabling our mission of Better Decisions, Faster, improving the standard of work on our accounts and giving our agency and clients a competitive advantage in the marketplace.

Balancing all of these competing priorities has become a huge challenge and could hinder our future growth. We need an efficient and pro-active individual to join us. We need help to focus on the right places so that we can deliver our commercial targets and also support the wider agency development roadmap.

Requirements


Experience using Business Intelligence platforms such as Datorama, Tableau or Power BI.
Proven working knowledge of data quality and reporting solutions .
Comfortable working with large datasets to extract meaningful insights.
You will provide support on answering ad-hoc queries from clients and internal client hub teams – supporting quality and effectiveness across all stages.
You will have direct relationships with our clients, for example as you help us to manage the actions from the weekly client status meetings.
Knowledge of coding languages including SQL, Python are preferable.
Knowledge of Datorama and looker studio is desirable.


At OMD EMEA, we strive to deliver on our promise of ‘better decisions, faster‘ for our clients, partners and all 6,000+ OMDers across our region every day. As part of the world’s largest media network, our business is staging experiences for consumers who have more choice and less attention than ever before. The key to the process is empathy. Empathy to see the world through the eyes of the consumer, to recognise the needs of our clients and to identify aspirations of our talent.

Learn Fast, Act Fast. To help navigate the road to a ‘new normal’, learning from, and acting upon data signals at scale and speed is crucial. Visit Why OMD? to learn more about our unique Act Fast Framework.

Be Your Best

We want everyone to make the most of the opportunity to shine and showcase your talents and we are happy to make adjustments in the recruitment process so you can be your best. Please discuss any specific requirements with your dedicated Talent Team member or if you would feel more comfortable, you can email us confidentially at beyourbest@omnicommediagroup.com to let us know how we can support you.

Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at OMG

At OMG, our vision is to be an agency where difference is valued and everyone is able to thrive in a culture of equality, inclusion and belonging. We are committed to providing a truly inclusive environment that reflects today’s society, where everyone is able to bring their true selves to work, and where diverse voices and backgrounds are valued, heard, and well-represented.

We will process your personal data in accordance with our Recruitment Privacy Notice which is available on https://omnicommediagroup.com/recruitment-privacy-notices/.
Show more

Title: Tableau Data Analyst
Description:
We are currently looking for a skilled, enthusiastic and proactive Data Analyst to join a great team in the Higher Education sector.




Higher Education experience is preferred, and must have Tableau experience/knowledge.




Main duties and responsibilities

As a member of the Insight team, your key responsibility will not only be to report on existing trends and ongoing performance but to identify and evaluate opportunities. To achieve this, you would be expected to be able to interpret and convert large complex data sets, using a range of methods and data transformation tools, create data visualisation, typically in Tableau and communicate key findings.




Using historical data and trends analysis, you will also be asked to create forecasts and models and summarise findings in easily digestible reports for decision making.




The Data Analyst would additionally undertake bespoke research and analyses in response to requests from the department.




Skill and experience required

Demonstrable experience of constructively challenging assumptions and traditional views, identifying issues and generating/implementing new, and adapting the tried and tested approaches to develop solutions to challenges and opportunities.




Demonstrable experience of using specialist analytical and reporting software or advanced functionality of Microsoft Excel, employing a range of practices to analyse and explain complex data sets. Demonstrable experience of using data visualisation software e.g. Tableau, Qlikview and Power BI to help uncover the stories behind the data.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst, looking for an opportunity to join a dynamic and growing company? We would like to hear from you.




A brand new role, you will be part of the growing Data Science Team. The Data Analyst will play a key role in a variety of business intelligence and analytical projects. This role is crucial in extracting value from our data and presenting insights in a meaningful and actionable way to the business. It is a highly visible position, frequently requiring presentations to the executive team and their leadership teams.







Responsible for working cross-functionally to collect and manipulate data from existing datasets. Mainly to develop data insights, including determining trends, patterns and relationships utilizing a wide variety of data sources and analytical techniques. Imports, cleans, transforms, or visualizes data with the purpose of understanding or making conclusions from the data for decision making purposes. Has in-depth experience of SQL, strong knowledge of data analytics. Usually determines approach and solution(s) for Analytics problems independently. Acts as resource for colleagues with less experience or a point of contact for colleagues outside the Analytics community.




Key Responsibilities:

Lead and execute analytics projects using a combination of open-source and cloud tools, driving innovation and delivering actionable insights.
Produces a variety of reports, graphs, summaries and presentations that convey analytic results and align with business needs
Performs diagnosis on root cause of data anomalies that are uncovered through normal course of analysis
Collaborate with product managers and designers to ensure the feasibility of product extensions and new products based on existing proprietary, quant and qual datasets
Work with outputs from Research and historical data to identify consistent and inconsistent product features and document precise requirements for improved consistency, diagnostic and explanatory power
Collaborate with designers, Tech colleagues and expert users to come up with engaging ways to visualise data and insights for non-technical audiences
Design and develop novel ways to present and highlight important analysis from complex data sets, including joining across datasets which do not perfectly match
Collaborate with Product, Tech, Research and other Commercial / Internal stakeholders to understand and define new, marketable product (or extensions) from existing data
Create and present progress reports and ad-hoc analysis to the key stakeholders and teams
Constantly think about and explain to stakeholders how analytics “product” could be refined and productionised in future
Work with Tech colleagues to improve the Data Science workspace / environment, including providing requirements for Data Lake / Data Pipeline / Data Engineering colleagues
Help us understand our customers (both internal and external) better, through analytics, so we can provide the right solutions to the right people, including proactively suggesting solutions for nebulous or ill-defined problems
Be responsible for end-to-end Data Analytics lifecycle : analysis of data, from data cleaning to extracting insights and recommending production approaches
Coach, guide, and nurture talent within the data science team, and wider Analytics community, enabling growth and skill development.




Skills and experience:

Delivering significant and valuable advanced analytics projects and/or assets in industry and/or professional services
Proven experience in data analytics and business intelligence
Proficiency in writing and optimizing complex SQL queries.
Proficiency in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards, with advanced technical knowledge in security, and re-usability
Previous experience working with a cloud-based data platform such as Microsoft Azure
Expertise in data analysis and deriving insights from data, with the initiative to deep dive into data and present findings to stakeholders
Comfortable presenting complex ideas to executive-level and technical stakeholders




Personal specifcation

Bachelors, Masters or PhD degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Maths, Physics, Operational Research or a related quant / STEM field
Comfortable to work with uncertainty and ambiguity, from initial concepts through iterations and conducting experiments to find the right products / services to launch
Excellent problem-solver & strong analytical skills
Proven aptitude to learn new tools, technologies, and methodologies
Understanding of requirements for software engineering and data governance in data science
Proven ability to lead and mentor data analysts across teams.
Evidence of taking a company or a department on a journey from simple to Advanced Analytics
Ability to translate complex analysis findings into a clear narrative and actionable insights
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to listen, and collaborate with non-technical and non-quant stakeholders
Work with client-facing and Tech teams to make sure that they fully understand the right data is being collected with sufficient quality and stored in an easy to analyse / reporting format
A good grounding in data ethics
Experience presenting analysis and insights to audiences from varying skill sets and backgrounds




Nice to have:

experience working with market research methods and market research datasets
experience in the professional services or legal sector
B2B market research would be a significant advantage




Equal Opportunity Statement

We are committed to fostering and promoting an inclusive professional environment for all of our employees, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion are integral values of Chambers and Partners and are key in our culture. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all qualified individuals regardless of age, disability, race, sex, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy and maternity. This commitment applies across all of our employment policies and practices, from recruiting and hiring to training and career development. We support our employees through our internal INSPIRE committee with Executive Sponsors, Chairs and Ambassadors throughout the business promoting knowledge and effecting change. As a Disability Confident employer, we will ensure that a fair number of disabled applicants that meet the minimum criteria for this position will be offered an interview.

This role is crucial in extracting value from our data and presenting insights in a meaningful and actionable way to the business. It is a highly visible position, frequently requiring presentations to the executive team and their leadership teams.



Responsible for working cross-functionally to collect and manipulate data from existing datasets. Mainly to develop data insights, including determining trends, patterns and relationships utilizing a wide variety of data sources and analytical techniques. Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst - InsurTech Scale-up - London (hybrid) - Up to £90,000 + bonus




numi has partnered with a game-changing InsurTech scale-up to hire a Senior Data Analyst for their high-performing analytics team!




This is an exciting opportunity to join a data-driven company that's revolutionising the insurance industry for underserved customers with cutting-edge technology. As their newest Senior Data Analyst, you'll be diving deep into customer data, uncovering insights that drive retention strategies, and helping to provide fair car insurance to underserved customers.




We're looking for a data whiz to join cross-functional teams in a low-ego, high-performance culture that offers amazing career growth opportunities.




You'll need...

Several years of experience as a Senior Data Analyst
Excellent DBT skills with 2+ years hands-on experience (this is a must!)
Strong SQL and Looker expertise
Experience in start-ups/scale-ups and agile environments
Proven track record in stakeholder management
Deep understanding of customer lifetime value and retention strategies
Comfort with fast-paced environments and a "fail fast, no blame" mentality




Bonus points for...

Background in subscription-based companies
Experience in the InsurTech sector




What's in it for you?

Salary up to £90,000 for the right candidate
Bonus and excellent benefits package
Hybrid working (2 days/week in office)
Chance to be part of an InsurTech revolution!




Interested? Apply now or reach out to daisy@wearenumi.com for more details and a chat about this exciting role!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Remote




Description:

We are seeking a Business Data Analyst to support our People Services in a large HRIS transformation project. You'll work with stakeholders to analyze and document requirements, particularly within HRIS and Payroll, ensuring seamless integration and efficiency improvements.




Key Skills and Experience:

Minimum 3 years of Business Analyst experience.
Proven track record in shared services and HR system implementations.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Experience with HR platforms like Workday, SAP, Oracle, Ceridian is a plus.
Ability to develop and monitor KPIs for process improvements.

Key Responsibilities:

Gather and document shared service requirements.
Analyze business processes and identify improvement opportunities.
Translate requirements into practical solutions with the project team.
Support the implementation and address any challenges.
Ensure alignment of shared services with project goals.
Continuously identify and implement improvements.

Title: Tableau Data Analyst
Description:
We are currently looking for a skilled, enthusiastic and proactive Data Analyst to join a great team in the Higher Education sector.




Higher Education experience is preferred, and must have Tableau experience/knowledge.




Main duties and responsibilities

As a member of the Insight team, your key responsibility will not only be to report on existing trends and ongoing performance but to identify and evaluate opportunities. To achieve this, you would be expected to be able to interpret and convert large complex data sets, using a range of methods and data transformation tools, create data visualisation, typically in Tableau and communicate key findings.




Using historical data and trends analysis, you will also be asked to create forecasts and models and summarise findings in easily digestible reports for decision making.




The Data Analyst would additionally undertake bespoke research and analyses in response to requests from the department.




Skill and experience required

Demonstrable experience of constructively challenging assumptions and traditional views, identifying issues and generating/implementing new, and adapting the tried and tested approaches to develop solutions to challenges and opportunities.




Demonstrable experience of using specialist analytical and reporting software or advanced functionality of Microsoft Excel, employing a range of practices to analyse and explain complex data sets. Demonstrable experience of using data visualisation software e.g. Tableau, Qlikview and Power BI to help uncover the stories behind the data.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst 📰 Digital News Media







💰 Salary: up to £35,000

🏠 Work Arrangement: Hybrid – 2 days per week in the office

📍Office: Central London







We are thrilled to partner with a prestigious digital news media company. They are seeking a Data Analyst to join their innovative Analytics Team.







🚀 This role is ideal for you if:

You want to kickstart your career in data analytics or move to an analytics role within media and would be excited to join one of the biggest media analytics teams in the UK.
You are passionate about combining maths and data.
You appreciate working in an environment that values independent thought, innovation, and diversity.
You have an interest in media and journalism







🔍 What are we looking for in the ideal candidate?

Experience using digital analytics tools like Google Analytics and Looker (Or Tableau)
Proficient in maths and Excel.
A people person, willing to learn and able to thrive under pressure.
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with various internal teams.







📈 Here’s what your role will entail:

You will run, improve and deliver weekly, monthly and ad-hoc reports for the internal team
Analyse data related to digital media, such as SEO, Social Media, Social Listening, Video Analytics, and Digital Analytics.
Work with the internal teams to brief them on digital performance and the latest trends.
You will represent the data team with non-technical teams.







🌱 Opportunity for growth

You can work within a large analytics team and will have opportunities to move up in role and seniority.
You can learn technical skills from other people in the team, with the opportunity to practice them in your role
You can work directly with the Head and Director of analytics and will have a chance to communicate with senior leaders.
You will have access to the latest technologies and platforms in the digital space.







📨 Are you ready to embark on a career path that blends data analytics with the fast-paced world of digital media?







Apply here!







⚖️ Equal Opportunities

We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. In accordance with the Equality Act 2010, we aim to create an environment where everyone can utilize their skills fully, free from discrimination or harassment, and where decisions are based solely on merit. We ensure no individual is treated less favorably on any discriminatory grounds, including age, disability, gender reassignment, marital status, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Business Data Analyst: Power BI, Alteryx, Automation, Actuarial
Business Data Analyst required for a dynamic Specialist Insurer, who are committed to leveraging data & analytics to drive their underwriting function. This is a multi-faceted role where you will support the actuarial reserving & finance team, contributing to improving data analysis & data quality capabilities.

Coming from the London Markets, you will have a deep understanding of business processes coupled with strong Data Analytical skills. You will have experience supporting large datasets and excellent knowledge of Alteryx & Power BI for reporting & automation tasks.

This is an ideal role for a business focused Data Analyst who is motivated by a data-first environment.


Responsibilities:

Collaborate with actuarial & finance function to support business needs & translate into data solutions
Utilize Alteryx & Power BI for reporting & automation tasks
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across data cleansing, collection and analysis
Identifying gaps and opportunities in Data findings, correcting data errors and improving data quality processes
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.


Requirements:

London Markets Insurance experience is required
Demonstrated experience working with Power BI and Alteryx
Experience supporting large amounts of data
Understanding of Data Quality procedures & processes
Ability to work with cross-functional departments i.e. finance, actuarial, underwriting etc


Business Data Analyst: Power BI, Alteryx, Automation, Actuarial

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
At Sweaty Betty, we’re more than just a global activewear and lifestyle brand for women.

We’re also a community that believes fitness is a flip-the-switch trigger for becoming the woman you want to be. Leggings and sports bras won’t change the world on their own. But with a grab-my-hand, let’s-go-for-it-now spirit, the women who wear them can.




If you want to join us on the next chapter of our adventure, you’re in the right place. This is an exciting opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst to join us on our mission to empower women through fitness and beyond.




SB Values:

∙ We Really Care ∙ First, Best, Bravest ∙ Our Strength is in Each Other ∙ Stand Up, Speak Up, Shout Out




Your primary purpose is to lead complex data analysis projects, transforming intricate datasets into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions and operational excellence. Through advanced analytics and compelling data storytelling, you'll collaborate across functions to deliver impactful business outcomes. Your role is pivotal in fostering a culture of experimentation and agile analytics practices that consistently deliver timely insights.




Key Responsibilities:

Partner with key stakeholders to define crucial metrics, create engaging data narratives and shape strategic direction.
Apply advanced analytical techniques to uncover trends and patterns, delivering actionable insights through compelling storytelling to guide business decisions.
Collaborate with the data team & subject matter experts to develop, build and deliver impactful data products
Create and maintain high-quality Power BI dashboards that clearly communicate KPIs and guide decision-making.
Collaborate with other analysts to foster a thriving analytics community and champion an agile, experimental approach to analytical challenges




Must Haves

Able to translate complex data into compelling stories for diverse audiences, including leadership.
Advanced proficiency in SQL and statistical analysis methods (e.g., Regression, Classification). Python is a bonus
Project management skills: experience in managing multiple stakeholders and end-to-end projects




The Extras

Generous clothing allowance
60% off all Sweaty Betty merchandise
25 days holiday, plus 8 flexible bank holidays
Sample sales
10 days work from anywhere policy
Company bonus scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Health Cash Plan benefit with Medicash available to all Sweaty Betty UK Employees
Enhanced Family Leave policy
Discounts at the best Studio Classes
SB Flexible Working: we currently work flexibly between the office and home




Our D&I Commitment

Our mission is to empower all women. This means doing more and working harder to make the long-lasting changes necessary to become an inclusive, diverse and actively anti-racist company. We care about our people, our community, our world. And we want to stand up for what we believe in.

We want to give our people a platform to use their voice. And actively listen and learn from what they have to say. This involves focusing on learning, development and progression across the business. Training our leaders, managers and teams about their rights under our equality, diversity and inclusion policy. And being clear on the responsibilities we hold to each other and our community. It also means being committed to equal employment opportunities. Ensuring we consider ALL applicants for jobs. And work harder to make our job advertising more inclusive.

Ultimately, we’re working to create a culture and team that represents our customers, our community and our mission of empowerment. We want to celebrate our diversity and the power it gives our team and our business.

We know we’re on a journey. And far from perfect. But we want to be a part of the solution to the problem. It might not be comfortable or straightforward. But if we weren’t up for doing the hard work and breaking the mould, we wouldn’t be Sweaty Betty. We are committed to working across our business and with our Internal Diversity & Inclusion Collective to be champions, allies and inclusive, always. Because when we say All, we mean it.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're hiring the very best data analysts to join our agile in-house team. You will be working on the fastest growing direct to consumer (e-commerce) brands and will have access to unlimited performance bonus.




What You'll Be Doing




Launch and optimize social, native and search advertising campaigns
Improve Conversion Rate across multiple funnels - multivariant and A/B testing
Design new funnels and analyse granular data using proprietary data warehouse
Manage unlimited budget while staying profitable. Compensation is directly correlated to your personal campaign performance and paid monthly
Optional managerial roles available




What You'll Need




Results-driven and numbers-oriented personality
High attention to detail
Flexibility and adaptability
Commitment to innovations




A little about us




We're passionate about building life changing consumer products and delivering them with astonishing service. We are also one of the UK's fastest growing direct to consumer companies.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Place: City Of London, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Business Data Analyst: Power BI, Alteryx, Automation, Actuarial
Business Data Analyst required for a dynamic Specialist Insurer, who are committed to leveraging data & analytics to drive their underwriting function. This is a multi-faceted role where you will support the actuarial reserving & finance team, contributing to improving data analysis & data quality capabilities.

Coming from the London Markets, you will have a deep understanding of business processes coupled with strong Data Analytical skills. You will have experience supporting large datasets and excellent knowledge of Alteryx & Power BI for reporting & automation tasks.

This is an ideal role for a business focused Data Analyst who is motivated by a data-first environment.


Responsibilities:

Collaborate with actuarial & finance function to support business needs & translate into data solutions
Utilize Alteryx & Power BI for reporting & automation tasks
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across data cleansing, collection and analysis
Identifying gaps and opportunities in Data findings, correcting data errors and improving data quality processes
Communicate findings and recommendations effectively to stakeholders at all levels of the organization.


Requirements:

London Markets Insurance experience is required
Demonstrated experience working with Power BI and Alteryx
Experience supporting large amounts of data
Understanding of Data Quality procedures & processes
Ability to work with cross-functional departments i.e. finance, actuarial, underwriting etc


Business Data Analyst: Power BI, Alteryx, Automation, Actuarial

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Immediate Start

Central London (4 days a week)

£45,000 - £50,000




The Company

A leading property investment and development firm specialising in the Student Accommodation and Build to Rent sectors. The focus is on investing, developing, and managing purpose-built assets to create sustainable and high-quality living environments.




The Role and Responsibilities

We are looking for a dynamic Data Analyst to join immediately. The successful candidate will develop data-driven insights for our investment team, focusing on sustainability, decarbonisation, and end-user behaviour.




Key Responsibilities:

Gather requirements from stakeholders across various teams.
Develop data for the investment team around sustainability, decarbonisation and end-user behaviour.
Design and build metrics, followed by creating data visualizations in Power BI or Tableau to support product launches.
Utilise a tech stack of BigQuery, Tableau, Power BI and SQL.







Your Experience

To qualify for this role, you will require the following:

Strong mathematical or statistical background.
Experience in either Tableau or Power BI.
Industry experience in investment or the real estate sector.
A proactive individual with a keen interest in the property investment and real estate industry, eager to learn and grow within the role.




How to Apply

Please send your CV via the Apply link on this website or send it to carlotashepherd@harnham.com.
